revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-24 19:48:44.000000000', 'message': "Remove the nova-api handling functions

The nova-api (commit 962790239b550be61b8eabcc5987aaf50c4f35c1)
introduced a 'nova-api' ready relation, but it was never added to the
metadata.yaml and it has never been used.  This commit removes it, as
there is no need for it after 3 years, and it therefore has a
maintenance burden, even if not being used.

Change-Id: I6b13e2639b808fd640a6f8d892d1e3dd58215361
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the nova-api handling functions

The nova-api (commit 962790239b550be61b8eabcc5987aaf50c4f35c1)
introduced a 'nova-api' ready relation, but it was never added to the
metadata.yaml and it has never been used.  This commit removes it, as
there is no need for it after 3 years, and it therefore has a
maintenance burden, even if not being used.

Change-Id: I6b13e2639b808fd640a6f8d892d1e3dd58215361

commit_message:
Returns disk_identifier for UEFI boot mode nodes

Returns the disk_identifer for the block device images which will be
needed in pxe_grub_config.template to boot wholedisk images in UEFI
boot mode.

Change-Id: I9882a81ae6d476fd26f3fe0dc00f6072454e3e5a
Story: 2005532
Task: 33673

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-03 11:53:59.000000000', 'message': "Add new Ansible role tripleo-container-backend.

Add a role to identify the container backend a specific container
is running at. Even though we have the container_cli variable, this
variable won't have the right container backend under the containers
are running in the case of an upgrade from Rocky to Stein (change
from Docker backend to Podman's). So we need a way to identify the
backend the container is present at.
Once identified (it will fail if the container is not running under
Docker or Podman), it will store the backend's command into a variable
passed to the role (similar to what function would do) to be used
outside of the role.

Change-Id: Ie2b4ffe4424aae97a0d1ee67607988188ff2686b

commit_message:
Add new Ansible role tripleo-container-backend.

Add a role to identify the container backend a specific container
is running under. Even though we have the container_cli variable, this
variable won't have the right container backend under the containers
are running in the case of an upgrade from Rocky to Stein (change
from Docker backend to Podman's). So we need a way to identify the
backend the container is present at.
Once identified (it will fail if the container is not running under
Docker or Podman and healtcheck is True), it will store the backend's
command into a variable passed to the role (similar to what function
would do) to be used outside of the role.
It also allows the option to verify the container's health state when
invoking the role via the healthcheck (boolean) option, which is set to false
by default.

Change-Id: Ie2b4ffe4424aae97a0d1ee67607988188ff2686b

commit_message:
Update repo_cmd for upgrades release files.

Several modifications have been done in the main
release files which were not included in the upgrades
ones. This patch tries to synchronize the scripts used
in repo_cmd_before, repos and repo_cmd_after in all
the <release>-undercloud-<release-1>-overcloud.yml
templates.
Also included the fix for LP#1785067 from the patch [0]
into the release files.

[0] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/595527/4

Change-Id: Ib2e33d23f89bb4db000b3c49dd01a61b3be8b207

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-12-05 08:37:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

This seems not needed to have it in the master branch, see https://review.openstack.org/622578. It might be more sense to submit this refactoring for Queens/Rocky only?'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-12-07 12:52:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)

> This seems not needed to have it in the master branch, see
 > https://review.openstack.org/622578. It might be more sense to
 > submit this refactoring for Queens/Rocky only?

Well, I tend to disagree...I think a way to verify if the services are up and running before the upgrade is needed. If we initiate the upgrade and some of the services is in an unhealthy state could or down, it could bring some issues during the upgrade and it's better to be aware of that state before even running the upgrade process itself. That's why I was thinking on moving these pre-upgrade checks into the external_upgrade_tasks, so the operator could run the tasks before and after the upgrade with a: 
openstack overcloud external_upgrade run --tags validation"}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-12-07 14:34:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-12-10 07:51:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-12-11 07:36:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-12-11 17:37:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 10:57:39.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add pre-upgrade validation step for containerized services.

At the moment there is not service checking before
upgrade when having a containerized deployment. This
patch includes the pre-upgrade validation tasks for
containerized services, leaving also the systemd checks
as they are being used for the containerized undercloud
upgrade.

In the case one of the containers is in state different
than healthy, the validation taks will stop the upgrade.

Change-Id: Id4f08e03fbd93f36da636e35db8ae51cd1e27ad6
Closes-Bug: #1781567

Depends-On: Ie2b4ffe4424aae97a0d1ee67607988188ff2686b

'}, {'created': '2018-12-07 14:34:52.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add pre-upgrade validation step for containerized services.

At the moment there is not service checking before
upgrade when having a containerized deployment. This
patch includes the upgrade validation tasks for containerized
services inside external_upgrade-tasks section. Like this,
we provide a way to execute service validations before and
after the upgrade, via openstack overcloud external-upgrade run
--tags validations.

In the case one of the containers is in state different
than healthy, the validation taks will fail.

Depends-On: Ie2b4ffe4424aae97a0d1ee67607988188ff2686b
Change-Id: Id4f08e03fbd93f36da636e35db8ae51cd1e27ad6
Closes-Bug: #1781567

services inside external_upgrade-tasks section. Like this,
we provide a way to execute service validations before and
after the upgrade, via openstack overcloud external-upgrade run
--tags validations.

In the case one of the containers is in state different
than healthy, the validation taks will fail.

Depends-On: Ie2b4ffe4424aae97a0d1ee67607988188ff2686b
Change-Id: Id4f08e03fbd93f36da636e35db8ae51cd1e27ad6
Closes-Bug: #1781567
'}, {'created': '2018-12-14 13:15:36.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add pre-upgrade validation step for containerized services.

At the moment there is not service checking before
upgrade when having a containerized deployment. This
patch includes the upgrade validation tasks for containerized
services inside upgrade-tasks section. Like this, we also provide
a way to execute service validations before and after the upgrade,
via openstack overcloud upgrade run --tags validations for any
specific role (via --roles Controller|Compute, etc...).

In the case one of the containers is in state different

commit_message:
WIP: Add pre-upgrade validation step for containerized services.

At the moment there is not service checking before
upgrade when having a containerized deployment. This
patch includes the upgrade validation tasks for containerized
services inside upgrade-tasks section. Like this, we also provide
a way to execute service validations before and after the upgrade,
via openstack overcloud upgrade run --tags validations for any
specific role (via --roles Controller|Compute, etc...).

In the case one of the containers is in state different
than healthy, the validation taks will fail.

Depends-On: Ie2b4ffe4424aae97a0d1ee67607988188ff2686b
Change-Id: Id4f08e03fbd93f36da636e35db8ae51cd1e27ad6
Closes-Bug: #1781567

commit_message:
Pass stable_release into nodepool_setup for reproducer_oooq.

If525e3db07976cd8d010074b22129ccec9dd09f7
added the control to avoid merging patches
from different branches when testing via
reproducer-quickstart.sh. However, the
variable 'stable_release' which is used
to differentiate if the patch belongs to
another relase or not, is not being set
at all at the time of calling the nodepool-setup
role.

Closes-Bug: #1758899
Change-Id: Ib6f8423ff7f5575dfa327ad4c6fc726bc55f4ca1

commit_message:
Change noauth strategy for plugin loading

Don't do it.

os-client-config's plugin loading has been causing this pain for a long
time, removing the KSC hack-around in o-c-c unmasked this again.  So when
auth is not reuired, just don't let o-c-c do any plugin loading at all.

Ever.

Of course, this shouldn't be in OSC either, but we have to do this until
the equivalent fix lands in osc-lib, is released and makes it into the
global requirements minimum version.

Partial-Bug: #1717524
Depends-on: Ie68c82f7b073012685f0513b615ab1bf00bc0c3a
Change-Id: Ifdf65f3bb90fb923947a2cbe80a881d71a3fee56
(cherry picked from commit 1c3cb0a3b54cdb6cd5b27e88372b65cfac844422)

commit_message:
WIP: Disable properly services api_cfn and api_cloudwatch.

The worker-config.yaml environment file is widely used in CI jobs,
including the upgrade/update ones. Disabling the services api_cfn
and api_cloudwatch in the way it was done, setting ::enabled to false
ends up conflicting with the upgrading process as the service is
not started but the TripleO is not really conscious that the service
is disabled as the variable 'service_name'_enabled remains true.

Specify default values for metadata handling as heat-api-cfn and
heat-api-cloudwatch services are disabled.

Depends-On: I7257f79af764cddc16423826143b0d8babfe54e7
Depends-On: I0536b5efd0e1389b05ffdd29acf75f1fa748babb
Partial-Bug: #1715083
Change-Id: I0a0e30836b2f8dfed1d7455984431ad876a6a383

commit_message:
Make SKIPPED_IMAGES more flexible

With introduction of new architectures, it seems reasonable to allow
skipping of images based on their architecture.
Additionally, the existing framework had unneccessary duplication.
This commit makes the feature more flexible and cleaner.
Existing skips have been programmatically rewritten.

Change-Id: I34c002a0ee605ca121d9d923b256e4fe1ea3d9aa
Signed-off-by: Rados≈Çaw Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>

commit_message:
SecurityGroupRule can not pass as Neutron/c/660174/

Neutron master submit https://review.opendev.org/#/c/660174/
while this result SecurityGroupRule can not pass bug
This patch is to avoid the problem

Change-Id: I1b6eeab827019a3ac3fc7373e6288cf4467a002a
signed-off-by: zhangchi <zhangchi@szzt.com.cn>
co-Authored-By: tangzhuo <ztang@hnu.edu.cn>

[{'account_id': 17788, 'date': '2017-03-24 08:52:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-03-24 08:53:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 17788, 'date': '2017-03-24 09:00:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2017-03-24 09:26:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
New project request: airship/docs

This adds a documentation project for Airship.  Currently, Airship
documentation is scattered across a handful of non-obvious projects.
At the PTG it was decided to create a single, clear home for
Airship-wide documentation as the project matures.
Existing documentation will migrate to this project, and new docs
will be authored here, once the project is created.

Change-Id: Ifab77cc746e0187611eda98776715909e4819af8

subject: Move task handling to manager
messages:
[{'account_id': 26263, 'date': '2018-04-04 00:43:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-06-25 04:21:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

this has been replaced by:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666774'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 00:43:18.000000000', 'message': 'Move task handling to manager

* First in a step of refactoring task handling
* Introduces a central handler for most task life cycle operations
  (cancel is left out)
* Calling self.process_actions is now deprecated, call
  self.task_manager.process_inital_request instead
* Slight API changes:
  * Notifications will now contain task.task_type rather than
    using the taskview class name
  * Token submission response is now "Task completed successfully"
* Auto-approval and duplication checking is now in place for task
  updates

Change-Id: I78f80c461f39ff2be0b0dec01fcc052a8d09766e
'}]
commit_message:
Move task handling to manager

* First in a step of refactoring task handling
* Introduces a central handler for most task life cycle operations
  (cancel is left out)
* Calling self.process_actions is now deprecated, call
  self.task_manager.process_inital_request instead
* Slight API changes:
  * Notifications will now contain task.task_type rather than
    using the taskview class name
  * Token submission response is now "Task completed successfully"
* Auto-approval and duplication checking is now in place for task
  updates

Change-Id: I78f80c461f39ff2be0b0dec01fcc052a8d09766e

messages:
[{'account_id': 30597, 'date': '2019-06-21 07:48:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-06-21 07:48:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-06-21 08:02:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

@huichen: Thanks for the patch. This feature seems like a bug fix or a performance improvement. Could you please file a bug in [1] and refer to that bug in the commit message? Also please propose such bugfix against the master branch first. And when the fix merged there you can propose backports from all the stable branches.

Cheers,
gibi

commit_message:
Open openvswitch_db_server port 6640 to interact with SDN controller

This change allows the openvswitch to interact with SDN controller
(e.g., ONOS, ODL) through 6640 port.

Story: 2005763
Task: 33473

Change-Id: Ifcbb6a157c230fa729d295ef0d3fb9a16fff60a2

commit_message:
Remove fluent-loggin from network-policy

This removes the old fluent-logging chart from network
policy and replaces it with the new fluentbit and fluentd
charts. This will return the network policy gate back to
passing

Change-Id: I060c6c3034fa798a131a053b9d496e5d8781c55d

commit_message:
Ingress: Update config to be compatible with k8s schema validation

This PS updates the ingress controller configmap to be valid with
k8s schema validation turned on.

Change-Id: Ibbc82be62398ee63eb353aa58f1ebdf98e66b30d
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

Fix discription error of loadbalanceir

The NorthBound DB is updated till a member is added to the
LoadBalancer

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-12 13:17:28.000000000', 'message': 'Read IP monitor changes in a parallel thread

In order to capture all IP address changes, the method reading the
netlink socket will be executed in a parallel thread. Once the
"ip_monitor" method is stopped, this blocking thread will be killed.

A new functional test, "test_add_multiple_ips", is added in order to
stress test this method.

Change-Id: I8f1de4a31f97bab734a33f94c3069444defd870f
Closes-Bug: #1832307

commit_message:
Read IP monitor changes in a parallel thread

In order to capture all IP address changes, the method reading the
netlink socket will be executed in a parallel thread. Once the
"ip_monitor" method is stopped, this blocking thread will be killed.

A new functional test, "test_add_multiple_ips", is added in order to
stress test this method.

Change-Id: I8f1de4a31f97bab734a33f94c3069444defd870f
Closes-Bug: #1832307

commit_message:
Specify AZ for non-scenario tests

The review allows related non-scenario tests which create
volumes and servers to read and use
CONF.compute.compute_volume_common_az.
If the tests don't use the option and tested environment has
multiple availability_zones, the tests fail.

Related-bug: #1647999

Change-Id: Ia0a6fd2175635d4375514d7609646b4516836dc0

commit_message:
Add bindep.txt for Octavia

Some base packages are no longer automatically included in zuul
job runs. This is good as we need to call out our platform package
requirements.
This patch adds a bindep.txt to Octavia to capture those
package requirements.

Change-Id: I48e82f39e3980d6d50e3b710326b8e437eddb08b

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Disable provider limestone""

This reverts commit 797796ee77dae0a19f24b3cfbb9e9007557c98df.
Connectivity is intermittent, causing AFS timeouts for the
mirror and so breaking builds scheduled there.

Change-Id: I5c682ab59bf570dcd3fd326a28467dc8a9ac7609

commit_message:
Retire independent ansible role

All of the tripleo ansible roles have been retired. The transformation squad
is pivoting away from independent roles at this time and will be focusing on
the tripleo-ansible repository. For more information on the tripleo-ansible
efforts and the direction of the transformation squad please review the
following mailing list thread [0].

This change adds zuul project config for the cookiecutter role which was
missing.

[0] - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/006836.html

Change-Id: Ic2d23cb2078d6ef00c13056a0b1c4fbac1d7fdde
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make kubernetes apiserver start after network

Without this, the service fails to start with

 runc[1150]: error: unable to find suitable network address.error='no
 default routes found in "/proc/net/route" or "/proc/net/ipv6_route"'.
 Try to set the AdvertiseAddress directly or provide a valid BindAddress
 to fix this

Story: 2005698
Task: 31019
Change-Id: I0da4381cdc06f15815bd5ae51417aaf93d36b2c1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-21 09:32:20.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "support http/https proxy for discovery url"

This reverts commit e8d0ee1b144f4db24367ad48bd2cb4306add6672.

This commit is reverted for two reasons:

* It is undesirable that the end user can inject proxy config into
  the magnum-conductor service via the cluster template.

* The proxy settings for the magnum-conductor service may not be
  the same as those which are required in the cluster template for
  the end user VM.

Systemd, docker and podman all include native mechanisms for setting
environment variables for proecesses, and this should be used by the
cloud operator / deployment tooling to configure the required proxy
settings for the magnum-conductor service.

In particular this patch makes it impossible for the cloud operator
to specify their own http_proxy via the environment, the user supplied
cluster template setting will always be used.

Change-Id: I33da19ad6764bedcf15f2a08381063e2471f8991
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "support http/https proxy for discovery url"

This reverts commit e8d0ee1b144f4db24367ad48bd2cb4306add6672.

This commit is reverted for two reasons:

* It is undesirable that the end user can inject proxy config into
  the magnum-conductor service via the cluster template.

* The proxy settings for the magnum-conductor service may not be
  the same as those which are required in the cluster template for
  the end user VM.

Systemd, docker and podman all include native mechanisms for setting
environment variables for proecesses, and this should be used by the
cloud operator / deployment tooling to configure the required proxy
settings for the magnum-conductor service.

In particular this patch makes it impossible for the cloud operator
to specify their own http_proxy via the environment, the user supplied
cluster template setting will always be used.

Change-Id: I33da19ad6764bedcf15f2a08381063e2471f8991

[{'created': '2019-03-21 21:07:02.000000000', 'message': "wip: bdm: store empty object as connection_info by default

there is a code route here where connection_info is None therefore
the stored value in `connection_info` is `null` which breaks other
parts of nova that depend on that string containing json

i'm pushing this up as i try to dig how this can happen..

Change-Id: I15a7c13edf78884ec223fd531a78a341106b41b8
"}, {'created': '2019-03-21 22:34:56.000000000', 'message': "bdm: store empty object as connection_info by default

There are several code paths which expect connection_info to be
a valid JSON object.  However, if we don't find a value, we are
setting it to an initial value of 'None' which evenutally gets
converted to 'null' as JSON and stored in the database.

This patch sets the default value to {} so that any new block
device mappings have an empty object, rather than NULL.

Change-Id: I15a7c13edf78884ec223fd531a78a341106b41b8

commit_message:
bdm: store empty object as connection_info by default

There are several code paths which expect connection_info to be
a valid JSON object.  However, if we don't find a value, we are
setting it to an initial value of 'None' which evenutally gets
converted to 'null' as JSON and stored in the database.

This patch sets the default value to {} so that any new block
device mappings have an empty object, rather than NULL.

Closes-Bug: #1821244
Change-Id: I15a7c13edf78884ec223fd531a78a341106b41b8

commit_message:
Import tripleo-container-tag role

This change imports the tripleo-container-tag role and adds testing using
molecule. Tests within this role will be delegated to the host so that
it can natively control both docker and podman containers.

To test this role the "openstack-tox-with-sudo" job is being used which
will allow the job to locally execute against the target node.

Change-Id: I7b30561137cd78b5a3d297fa26115dbfe4458e06
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

[{'created': '2019-06-20 17:10:42.000000000', 'message': 'Improve documentation readability

The role documentation titles were too long, and being truncated
in the site sidebar. This change shortens the title names so that
the its easier to navigate the documentation.

commit_message:
Improve documentation readability

The role documentation titles were too long, and being truncated
in the site sidebar. This change shortens the title names so that
the its easier to navigate the documentation.

An update has been made to the role-addition playbook so that the
new role titles are generated with the shorter length.

Change-Id: Icee3c318ac0049eda586c2696d732415575eaa40
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

subject: Import octavia roles and playbooks from tripleo-common
messages: [{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-06-13 22:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-06-14 15:12:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2019-06-16 15:12:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-06-24 22:15:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-13 22:31:56.000000000', 'message': "Import octavia roles and playbooks from tripleo-common

This change imports all of the octavia playbooks and roles from
`tripleo-common/playbooks/`. This change ensures all of the resources
imported are meeting the required lint checks for import and structures
the roles such that they'll automatically be installed in the
`usr/share/ansible/roles/` path making them available to the rest of
the tripleo ecosystem.

Change-Id: Ib4ff59a4c372f95cc7a183e8ef724bb1cbf72fed
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Import octavia roles and playbooks from tripleo-common

This change imports all of the octavia playbooks and roles from
`tripleo-common/playbooks/`. This change ensures all of the resources
imported are meeting the required lint checks for import and structures
the roles such that they'll automatically be installed in the
`usr/share/ansible/roles/` path making them available to the rest of
the tripleo ecosystem.

Change-Id: Ib4ff59a4c372f95cc7a183e8ef724bb1cbf72fed
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Schedule a periodical check of requirements to catch py2.7 issues quickly

Prepare a periodic job used to check possible issue on requirements
due to the python 2.7 final countdown and requirements
who remove python 2.7 support. We will check it daily
to see potential errors quickly outside the
standard development lifecycle (feature, fix, etc...)

Change-Id: I7773e41ec48246fb56e7366a359c067788c9f5bb

commit_message:
Improve steps to install from git in Quick Start

Essentially, kolla and kolla-ansible eventually have to be
installed, and that wasn't clear from the existing Quick Start.

Adds steps with:
$ python setup.py install

Change-Id: Id511db86adb749b8ab63d277dd6af143ad5e5a59

commit_message:
Add support for Sphinx v2.1

Come a new Sphinx version, come new breakages. This one is because of
commit 107c20a11f [1], which changed the default centering style of
tables.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/107c20a11f

Change-Id: I1155300828ad0012bd80b7615a0baca121c5e72e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: Ifc243b812803ec7a015bd2bf53988d9567fca116
Story: #2005924
Task: #34205

commit_message:
Set IPv6 params True if undercloud local_ip is IPv6

When deploying the undercloud using an IPv6 control plane
the set various parameters for IPv6 to True.

Change-Id: I101c4c70f2804779089ba25720141a9320270edc
Closes-Bug: #1831315

commit_message:
[etcd] Move etcd storage to tmpfs

The PS allows to use tmpfs for etcd during the gates.
There is an assumption that it will improve the performance and
will allow to get rid of weird issues.

Change-Id: Id68645b6535c9b1d87c133431b7cd6eb50fb030e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-19 09:07:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix galera_client installation for openSUSE Leap 15.1

The MariaDB repositories are offering a download repo under

commit_message:
Fix galera_client installation for openSUSE Leap 15.1

The MariaDB repositories are offering a download repo under
the leap major version, e.g. "opensuse15" or "opensuse42" for all leap
42.x and leap 15.x versions, respectively. There isn't a specific
build for openSUSE Leap 15.1, so the previous logic selected
a repo url of opensuse-151 which does not exist.

Change-Id: I64c6796e4324717dd98aa8488bc3e83b31073c45

messages: [{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-24 16:05:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-06-24 16:07:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-06-24 16:18:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-24 16:05:47.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Add irrelevant files in dsvm job"

This reverts commit 52ae954bd09bbb1536bc03b0be334d02e66fe93c.

The change ignored way too many things that should be run
through the functional dsvm job, such as changes to the
functional tests themselves, requirements, setup.cfg and
tox.ini changes. The bug was about not running the dsvm
functional job on docs changes and then went much further
and clearly not much thought was put into what was being
ignored and if it should have been, so let's just revert
and have a do-over.

Change-Id: Ie78badfeed7e51f1786eb5041010c7d17b02e412
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add irrelevant files in dsvm job"

This reverts commit 52ae954bd09bbb1536bc03b0be334d02e66fe93c.

The change ignored way too many things that should be run
through the functional dsvm job, such as changes to the
functional tests themselves, requirements, setup.cfg and
tox.ini changes. The bug was about not running the dsvm
functional job on docs changes and then went much further
and clearly not much thought was put into what was being
ignored and if it should have been, so let's just revert
and have a do-over.

Change-Id: Ie78badfeed7e51f1786eb5041010c7d17b02e412

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-31 14:26:37.000000000', 'message': 'Use neutron-legacy on subnodes in devstack zuul job

There are still some issues with lib/neutron thus neutron-legacy is used
on controller node in multinode jobs and in single node jobs.
But in "group-vars" in devstack job it was configured to use
lib/neutron which can cause some problems in multinode jobs.

So lets switch to neutron-legacy on subnodes also until lib/neutron
will be ready to use everywhere.

Change-Id: I0d7f9f2baaee2836a719f199939156bd4f53f778
'}]
commit_message:
Use neutron-legacy on subnodes in devstack zuul job

There are still some issues with lib/neutron thus neutron-legacy is used
on controller node in multinode jobs and in single node jobs.
But in "group-vars" in devstack job it was configured to use
lib/neutron which can cause some problems in multinode jobs.

So lets switch to neutron-legacy on subnodes also until lib/neutron
will be ready to use everywhere.

Change-Id: I0d7f9f2baaee2836a719f199939156bd4f53f778

[{'created': '2019-06-18 14:44:28.000000000', 'message': 'Update git.openstack.org to opendev.org

Everything that goes to git.openstack.org gets redirected to
opendev.org so this change updates the former links to the latter
to avoid the redirect.

Note that I also ran tools/generate-devstack-plugins-list.sh which
regenerated doc/source/plugin-registry.rst.

Change-Id: I78e3bb5303718962f591117f9c0ee11f2314b128
Partial-Bug: #1833256
'}, {'created': '2019-06-18 14:55:48.000000000', 'message': 'Update (git|review).openstack.org links to opendev

This updates links going to git.openstack.org and review.openstack.org
to go to their respective opendev locations to avoid redirects.

Note that I also ran tools/generate-devstack-plugins-list.sh which
regenerated doc/source/plugin-registry.rst. As a result, several
projects with devstack plugins which are no longer under the openstack
namespace have been dropped from the plugin registry since they are now
in namespaces like "x" and "starlingx".

Change-Id: I78e3bb5303718962f591117f9c0ee11f2314b128

commit_message:
Update (git|review).openstack.org links to opendev

This updates links going to git.openstack.org and review.openstack.org
to go to their respective opendev locations to avoid redirects.

Change-Id: I78e3bb5303718962f591117f9c0ee11f2314b128
Closes-Bug: #1833256

commit_message:
Remove faulty placement::config leftovers

Ifacef570b2296b1b62c75d850c6059562ec4cb1c removed the leftover auth
parameters in placement::config.

This removes them from the placement template as they are not used
and duplicate from what is set via placement::keystone::

Change-Id: I40df01e75f042176984b31fa5c4811302f9463d1

commit_message:
Remove tuned puppet manifest

The tuned puppet manifest is being removed because the heat template
which invoked it has been converted to ansible. This change removes
the tuned manifest and spec files accordingly.

Depends-On: I06d07f6f0949095cb716dd706e05f2e567c0d3d8

Change-Id: I1c76efb07474f8b0f5e226712aad30a75f6843af
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

[{'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-06-24 07:50:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-06-24 07:53:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Lets check if this really cause problem in neutron CI jobs. DNM patch to test that is in https://review.opendev.org/667036'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-06-24 07:57:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think the empty commit message is going to fly, but I guess reverting makes sense as a quick fix if we've broken the neutron gate.

I know Sean and Rodolfo have discussed this privately over email, the working theory is that the original patch doesn't take into account same host reverts, during which the port binding is never actually updated because it never leaves the single host in the first place.

Ideally we would get a real fix proposed quickly, and not have the need for this patch, but realistically that may not be possible, so I'm ok with this. Commit message still needs updating though."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-06-24 08:04:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

 > account same host reverts, during which the port binding is never

 > first place.
 > 
 > Ideally we would get a real fix proposed quickly, and not have the
 > need for this patch, but realistically that may not be possible, so
 > I'm ok with this. Commit message still needs updating though.

Sure, I will update commit message once jobs on my DNM patch to neutron will pass and we will be sure that this revert fixes Neutron problem."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-06-24 08:41:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/667035/1 : SUCCESS in 2h 21m 55s'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-06-24 10:36:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-06-24 11:09:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

i am pretty sure i know the reason for the issue.
the current patch does not handel the same host revert case.

i would prefer to add a followup patch to skip that rather then revert this. ill see if i can submit that today.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-06-24 11:40:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> i am pretty sure i know the reason for the issue.
 > the current patch does not handel the same host revert case.
 > 
 > i would prefer to add a followup patch to skip that rather then
 > revert this. ill see if i can submit that today.

IIUC resize and revert on the same host is also "real case" and can be done by user of the cloud. And IMO such use case is now broken. So skipping test is not the solution here. Maybe it would be better to revert this change which breaks such functionality and propose than new patch which will include fix for it too.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-06-24 13:08:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/667035/2 : SUCCESS in 2h 28m 25s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-24 13:36:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> i would prefer to add a followup patch to skip that rather then revert this.

I'm assuming by "skip" Sean doesn't mean skip a test but rather skip waiting for an event that won't come.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-24 13:49:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Looks like the revert fixes the problem:

http://logs.openstack.org/36/667036/2/check/neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid/109d3e8/

Do we know if the same host resize revert behavior where the event doesn't come is specific to this vif type? Because clearly in the tempest-full job where we're using ovs without hybrid firewall plugging the resize revert is OK, but I guess in that case we consider it a "plug time" event and we didn't change the behavior. The patch being reverted only changed the behavior for the ovs hybrid plug ports to wait for the binding event in the compute manager. Does this mean that for ovs hybrid plug ports on the same host resize we still get the event but at plug time (in the driver) rather than bind time (in the compute manager)? If so, that seems really weird and inconsistent to me and is a major part of the reason I said when approving the original change that I would not be surprised at all if we broke something because it's so hard to predict when we will or will not get the events from neutron depending on the vif type being used and scenario we're running (I wish there were some more official docs around this in neutron so we could reference it as nova developers).'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-24 13:59:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm OK with doing the revert to give some breathing room to work on the proper combined fix which we can then test with either a neutron patch that depends on it to run the neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid job or we could add neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid to the nova experimental queue and test it ourselves. It sounds like the commit message should be updated though to at least mention that the regression is due to neutron not sending the network-vif-plugged event for ovs hybrid plug ports for a same-host resize because the host binding does not change."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-06-24 14:08:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This reverts commit 19f9b37721d9bc13bc1ed35a4f368b1d21b10a5b.

Commit 19f9b37721d9bc13bc1ed35a4f368b1d21b10a5b introduced
a regression and caused errors on Neutron CI jobs which run
on a single node with iptables_hybrid firewall driver.
This is because the nova change made the resize revert flow
wait for neutron-vif-plugged events in the ComputeManager
when the port's host binding changes for iptables_hybrid
ports but for those types of ports, Neutron does not send
the event if the host does not change - which is the case
for a same-host resize being reverted.

Change-Id: I77b3639435c671bacca9cdfc1aa203e44a2fb042
Closes-Bug: #1833902
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Revert resize: wait for events according to hybrid plug"

This reverts commit 19f9b37721d9bc13bc1ed35a4f368b1d21b10a5b.

Commit 19f9b37721d9bc13bc1ed35a4f368b1d21b10a5b introduced
a regression and caused errors on Neutron CI jobs which run
on a single node with iptables_hybrid firewall driver.
This is because the nova change made the resize revert flow
wait for neutron-vif-plugged events in the ComputeManager
when the port's host binding changes for iptables_hybrid
ports but for those types of ports, Neutron does not send
the event if the host does not change - which is the case
for a same-host resize being reverted.

Change-Id: I77b3639435c671bacca9cdfc1aa203e44a2fb042
Closes-Bug: #1833902

makes sense, with clear state.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-06-20 08:33:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

Putting a temporary -W on this whilst I do additional tests in a live environment, further reviews welcome'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-06-20 10:26:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

I feel, that I'm missing smth, but...

Since we don't force people to move to symlinks (as we don't ever drop dir /etc/keystone), is there any reason to leave symlinks and care in the future about 2 possible situations? As we will be copying everything from venv every single time

Won't people after migration be missing some configs (or they will be unmanageable) as we don't keep everything because of smart sources?

Isn't it better to move *_key_repository to some other place by default, and cover this with upgrade script?"}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-06-20 11:15:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I feel, that I'm missing smth, but...
 > 

Me too probably :)

 > Since we don't force people to move to symlinks (as we don't ever
 > drop dir /etc/keystone), is there any reason to leave symlinks and
 > care in the future about 2 possible situations? As we will be
 > copying everything from venv every single time
 > 

I think we do force migration to a symlink now as the Stein code stands, and the current code completely deletes /etc/keystone and its contents? My /etc/keystone directory from Rocky was deleted and replaced with an empty dir in the venv and a symlink.

The data will only be copied from the venv once back to /etc/keystone, when stat.islnk is true.

 > Won't people after migration be missing some configs (or they will
 > be unmanageable) as we don't keep everything because of smart
 > sources?

I'm not sure, do you have an example? As far as i know for a source install the only files present in /etc/keystone are the ones placed there by OSA, and the fernet keys.

 > 
 > Isn't it better to move *_key_repository to some other place by
 > default, and cover this with upgrade script?

There was talk about this on irc yesterday and mnaser suggested this would be a bit of an anti-pattern as every other openstack deployment puts these things in /etc/keystone."}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-06-20 11:16:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2019-06-20 11:55:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This looks like a good solution to get things back on the rails. Small fix up using synchronize module instead of shelling out would be good but lgtm otherwise.

I still would be in favor of a full revert of smart sources and any config ‚Äúversioning‚Äù we do on target hosts. Our configs are already versioned in config management using git, and the way smart sources is implemented created a lot of opportunity for bugs like this and serve very little purpose since the ‚Äúversioning‚Äù provided can only be used in a rollback scenario with kludgy manual operations by the deployer. Ansible will never use smart sources configs, even in a rollback scenario, since it is going to template out new configs each run regardless.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-06-20 12:08:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> I think we do force migration to a symlink now as the Stein code stands, and the current code completely deletes /etc/keystone and its contents? My /etc/keystone directory from Rocky was deleted and replaced with an empty dir in the venv and a symlink.

It's true now, but with your patch this is not going to happen. So we will result in /etc/keystone being a directory for those, who migrate from Rocky, and symlink for new installations. So for migrated deployments files won't be copied from venv as well.

> Won't people after migration be missing some configs

Yep, you're right, it's not the case, as https://review.opendev.org/#/c/588960/ didn't drop any template"}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-06-20 12:22:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

[{'created': '2019-06-19 19:44:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix loss of fernet tokens on Rocky to Stein upgrade for source installs

The introduction of smart-soures in [1] created a code path
which deletes the /etc/keystone directory before symlinking it
into the keystone venv and creating the necessary config files.

Unfortunatley this has the side effect of also deleting any fernet
keys which pre-existed in the case of an upgrade from Rocky, and
re-initialising a new key. The original keys are deleted in a way
which is unrecoverable in the absence of a backup taken by the
operator.

For minor upgrades between versions of Stein the smart-sources
code would have created a new empty /etc/keystone directory in
the newly created upgrade venv and re-initialised the fernet keys
as would happen for a fresh installation, however the old keys
would be recoverable manually from the previous venv.

This change simplifies the smart-sources code to always keep the
keystone config files and fernet keys in the host /etc/keystone.
This ensures that the lifecycle of the fernet keys is not coupled
to the lifecycle of the keystone venvs.

In addition, tasks are added to rescue any keys which have been
created in the keystone venv by installations from the Stein
release-candidate.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/588960/

Change-Id: Ide611fd3d88e352367220f05dbcf4186ac20319f

'}, {'created': '2019-06-20 15:48:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix loss of fernet and credential keys during Rocky to Stein upgrade

This applies only to source based installations.

The introduction of smart-sources in [1] created a code path
which deletes the /etc/keystone directory before symlinking it
into the keystone venv and creating the necessary config files.

Unfortunatley this has the side effect of also deleting any fernet
and credential keys which pre-existed in the case of an upgrade from
Rocky. The original keys were deleted simulataneously across the whole
keystone_all group in a way which is makes them unrecoverable in
the absence of a backup taken by the operator.

This change simplifies the smart-sources code to always keep the
keystone config files and fernet keys in the host /etc/keystone.
This ensures that the lifecycle of the fernet keys is not coupled
to the lifecycle of the keystone venvs.

In addition, a task is added to rescue any keys which have been
created in the keystone venv by installations from the Stein
release-candidate.

Closes-Bug: 1833414
Change-Id: Ide611fd3d88e352367220f05dbcf4186ac20319f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix loss of fernet and credential keys during Rocky to Stein upgrade

This applies only to source based installations.

The introduction of smart-sources in [1] created a code path
which deletes the /etc/keystone directory before symlinking it
into the keystone venv and creating the necessary config files.

Unfortunatley this has the side effect of also deleting any fernet
and credential keys which pre-existed in the case of an upgrade from
Rocky. The original keys were deleted simulataneously across the whole
keystone_all group in a way which is makes them unrecoverable in
the absence of a backup taken by the operator.

This change simplifies the smart-sources code to always keep the
keystone config files and fernet keys in the host /etc/keystone.
This ensures that the lifecycle of the fernet keys is not coupled
to the lifecycle of the keystone venvs.

In addition, a task is added to rescue any keys which have been
created in the keystone venv by installations from the Stein
release-candidate.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/588960/

Closes-Bug: 1833414
Change-Id: Ide611fd3d88e352367220f05dbcf4186ac20319f

Looks good.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2019-06-24 15:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-22 15:20:19.000000000', 'message': 'Don't call .c from select() objects

The .c attribute on a SQLAlchemy select() object implicitly
creates an unnamed subquery when invoked, and the columns
returned are in reference to this subquery, not the SELECT
statement itself.   The usefulness of
this subquery is close to zero, whereas it confuses users
with its misleading behaviors,  complicates the internals,
and is rejected by the two leading databases (PostgreSQL and
MySQL) at the SQL level in any case, and as such it's going
away most likely in SQLAlchemy 1.4, after
a short deprecation period that has yet to be announced in the 1.3
series.

Keystone's schema-oriented unit tests appear to be applying
the select() construct to a Table object that's been reflected with
autoload for the usually immediate purpose of iterating through
the columns of this Table and comparing them to a set of
comparison tuples, however the ".c." collection
is available on all "from clause" objects of which Table is a
member so there is no need to apply a select() first.  In particular,
there is a reference to an internal
SQLAlchemy API "_proxies" which is attempting to reconcile the
fact that the implicitly created subquery columns don't refer
to the original Table column's "default" parameter (there is in fact
a public API for this system as well, but it is not needed
once the select() is removed).

This patch removes the "select()" applied to the Table returned
by select_table() and renames the method to load_table() to more
accurately reflect what this method does.   The use of SQLAlchemy's
private "_proxies" API can now be removed, and the two occurrences
where the select() were actually used to invoke a SELECT
statement are replaced with explicit
production of a select() construct as well as making use of the
already-present Session to invoke the query rather than using
an out-of-band ad-hoc transaction (connectionless execution is
also going away by SQLAlchemy 2.0 in any case).

Change-Id: Ica7037541a1305308ed743d8e04a3c2f02a2b811
'}]
commit_message:
Don't call .c from select() objects

The .c attribute on a SQLAlchemy select() object implicitly
creates an unnamed subquery when invoked, and the columns
returned are in reference to this subquery, not the SELECT
statement itself.   The usefulness of
this subquery is close to zero, whereas it confuses users
with its misleading behaviors,  complicates the internals,
and is rejected by the two leading databases (PostgreSQL and
MySQL) at the SQL level in any case, and as such it's going
away most likely in SQLAlchemy 1.4, after
a short deprecation period that has yet to be announced in the 1.3
series.

Keystone's schema-oriented unit tests appear to be applying
the select() construct to a Table object that's been reflected with
autoload for the usually immediate purpose of iterating through
the columns of this Table and comparing them to a set of
comparison tuples, however the ".c." collection
is available on all "from clause" objects of which Table is a
member so there is no need to apply a select() first.  In particular,
there is a reference to an internal
SQLAlchemy API "_proxies" which is attempting to reconcile the
fact that the implicitly created subquery columns don't refer
to the original Table column's "default" parameter (there is in fact
a public API for this system as well, but it is not needed
once the select() is removed).

This patch removes the "select()" applied to the Table returned
by select_table() and renames the method to load_table() to more
accurately reflect what this method does.   The use of SQLAlchemy's
private "_proxies" API can now be removed, and the two occurrences
where the select() were actually used to invoke a SELECT
statement are replaced with explicit
production of a select() construct as well as making use of the
already-present Session to invoke the query rather than using
an out-of-band ad-hoc transaction (connectionless execution is
also going away by SQLAlchemy 2.0 in any case).

Change-Id: Ica7037541a1305308ed743d8e04a3c2f02a2b811

commit_message:
use object event_types from neutron-lib

This patch consumes the OVO event_types from neutron-lib by removing
the module from neutron and using it from lib instead.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I3bc3ceb0c47766b0984b67081c4c7d243b8609c2

This seems a little complicated for normal user, so can we do more things in testcase and left less for user to config?'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-06-14 11:56:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)

> (4 comments)
 > 
 > This seems a little complicated for normal user, so can we do more
 > things in testcase and left less for user to config?

Yes this is complicated but by hiding this behind a feature configurable the `normal` user will not have to worry about any of this by default. The actual test adds no value at present anyway without valid certificates being provided.

Any users looking to run this test will have to invest a small amount of time generating the required certs, signing an image and calculating the signature of the image etc but it's all well documented below:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/certificate-validation.html

I really don't think it's worthwhile automating any of this in Tempest itself, devstack maybe but not directly in Tempest.

FWIW this also addresses the current race documented in the bug that's hitting our downstream CI at present. If this still too complicated my only other suggestion is to rm -rf the test itself from Tempest."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-06-18 08:16:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-06 10:49:53.000000000', 'message': 'compute: Make image certificate validation a configurable feature

tempest.api.compute.servers.test_servers.ServerShowV263Test would
previously always run and provide the optional
trusted_image_certificates parameter to validate the 2.63 API
microversion. However if the test image had not been cached locally this
would actually cause the underlying certificate validation logic within
Nova to be called resulting in the test failing as the test image would
not have the required img_signature_* properties set and the provided
trusted certificates are just test strings.

This change makes this specific test optional (not running by default)

commit_message:
compute: Make image certificate validation a configurable feature

tempest.api.compute.servers.test_servers.ServerShowV263Test would
previously always run and provide the optional
trusted_image_certificates parameter to validate the 2.63 API
microversion. However if the test image had not been cached locally this
would actually cause the underlying certificate validation logic within
Nova to be called resulting in the test failing as the test image would
not have the required img_signature_* properties set and the provided
trusted certificates are just test strings.

This change makes this specific test optional (not running by default)
now by introducing two required compute configurables. These allow a
signed image with the required img_signature_* properties set along with
a valid list of trusted image certificates to also be used during the
test.

Ica1d32ca66d6f89692e9cc90e415bf569332f58d is currently attempting to
wire up various image certificate and signature validation tests under
the barbican-tempest-plugin.

Change-Id: Ib346d383c430d5151d9aafa6e856dd0a7cae8a23
Closes-bug: 1831866

messages:
[{'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-13 21:22:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-14 14:56:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-14 16:02:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-06-14 16:13:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(7 comments)

couple of nits and questions but otherwise looks like a good start.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-14 16:28:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Kevin, thanks for the feedback.

I was just talking to Sorin and he brought up that I should remove the yamllint file so that was oversight on my side.

Python 2 is installed to provide /usr/bin/python for Ansible to use. I would prefer Python 3 but that adds a few extra steps for setting /usr/bin/python to use python3 (using `alternatives` or at least symlinks). Fedora 28, in particular, does not ship any version of Python by default.

LXC/LXD do not work well on CentOS/Fedora. Or, at least, not out-of-the-box. A few extra steps for configuration are required to get networking working. There is BZ open for it that I opened a while back. I will need to track that down. Another potential route is to use OpenStack instances (CI provides access to an OpenStack cloud) but that makes testing locally more difficult.

I will also sync the Dockerfile from the skeleton directory in the tripleo-ansible project.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-14 16:33:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-14 16:35:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Okay, yamllint removed (it's redundant) and the Dockerfiles removed (they are unused). These tests require full virtualization to run docker or podman so I suspect we may need to continue conversations about how to handle that."}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-14 16:37:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-06-14 16:55:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Kevin, thanks for the feedback.
 > 
 > I was just talking to Sorin and he brought up that I should remove
 > the yamllint file so that was oversight on my side.
 > 
 > Python 2 is installed to provide /usr/bin/python for Ansible to
 > use. I would prefer Python 3 but that adds a few extra steps for
 > setting /usr/bin/python to use python3 (using `alternatives` or at
 > least symlinks). Fedora 28, in particular, does not ship any
 > version of Python by default.
 > 
 > LXC/LXD do not work well on CentOS/Fedora. Or, at least, not
 > out-of-the-box. A few extra steps for configuration are required to
 > get networking working. There is BZ open for it that I opened a
 > while back. I will need to track that down. Another potential route
 > is to use OpenStack instances (CI provides access to an OpenStack
 > cloud) but that makes testing locally more difficult.
 > 
 > I will also sync the Dockerfile from the skeleton directory in the
 > tripleo-ansible project.

we might be able to accomplish local testing by allowing the containers we create to access the docker socket effectively providing a "docker in docker" like experience (same for podman just without the daemon using an init style container.

for reference - https://jpetazzo.github.io/2015/09/03/do-not-use-docker-in-docker-for-ci/ 

As for privledged init containers I'm doing that already with tuned which can be seen here - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ansible/blob/master/tripleo_ansible/roles/tuned/molecule/default/molecule.yml#L8-L26 - I suspect doing a privileged container with systemd would be enough to make podman in podman go, however, I've not tried it just yet.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-20 20:28:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-20 20:30:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-20 20:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from Iaf92ef4a35f3deba36822e50300d62a4975c5cd4 to molecule'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-06-21 11:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-06-21 17:02:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

because the tests for this role can't pass with the general tox-molecule job as it stands, I think it might be best to simply import this role into tripleo-ansible where the role will be tested in isolation.

In the very near term all of the roles will be transitioned to tripleo-ansible so I'm not sure there's a lot of benefit in hacking in new jobs to isolated tests here when all of that already exists elsewhere."}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-06-21 17:52:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Make a feature request on pytest-molecule so I cam implement some kind 
of @skip support.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-21 18:11:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Thanks, folks. I will look into migrating this role to the tripleo-ansible repository instead.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-21 20:18:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

I got a patch up for tripleo-ansible here, based off of Kevin's migration work: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666907/"}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-24 19:17:26.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This patch has been moved over to the new one for tripleo-ansible.'}]

commit_message:
Use BatchMode to check whether host is accessible via SSH

If password authentication is not disabled on the server, we may be
prompted for a password if the Kayobe Ansible user doesn't exist or
isn't configured for passwordless authentication.

By using BatchMode, the ssh command can fail quickly and proceed to
create the Kayobe Ansible user using the bootstrap user.

Change-Id: If22ed34dc4b6e87f8cf76c302948c955bddf2bc5

commit_message:
Switch infra puppet apply jobs to legacy base

These jobs rely on the zuul cloner shim to install puppet modules. Swith
their parent to legacy base so that they get z-c shim installed.

Change-Id: I2f8ffe95cd711eca44c547bdecb1a2d7eceda2d9

Closes-bug: #1831092

commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix race condition issues on vserver deletion

This patch updates the NetApp driver handling with an issue that
happens when the driver tries to delete the vserver, during a
rollback operation inside the vserver creation method.

Change-Id: I0c8468c72e15c1d27f5cdfa50cfc379a9207c5f1
Closes-bug: #1831092

messages:
[{'account_id': 30445, 'date': '2019-06-24 17:08:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-06-24 17:08:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

[{'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-06-03 16:38:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-06-05 10:46:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

First, I do not see a job running molecule. Is one?

I used pytest to wrap molecule calls because it has a very good HTML reporting which can contain the fully-colored output for each execution.

I see that tripleo-common is using stestr which has different reporting, I am not sure if it supports coloring for stdout (important for me).'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-06-05 11:50:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

playbook.yml is missing and is needed by molecule.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2019-06-05 13:54:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add common files that will be used across Molecule tests.

This will avoid duplicated code by using symlinks to these files.

Change-Id: I545018d154acc2a4daf9426a34b5314c215a6fe5
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>

subject: Switch python3 versions of test jobs to match Train PTI
messages:
[{'account_id': 30615, 'date': '2019-06-24 09:23:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-06-24 09:23:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-06-24 10:55:26.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to python3-train'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-06-24 10:55:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2019-06-24 11:12:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Switch python3 versions of test jobs to match Train PTI

In Train, we will use python 3.6 and 3.7 for python3 runtime
in our gate jobs [1]. This commit also adds python 3.7.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: Ie0f55b10077547e9842aa476caff0478068dd059

Great. Some details to be added still.'}, {'account_id': 26222, 'date': '2019-04-09 01:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)

I only have question about the maintenance url here "v1.0/vnfs/<vnf-uuid>/maintenance/<project_id>". How does Fenix know this url?

IMO, we can put Fenix configuration in tacker.conf and then in Fenix side, it can receive VNF information as it's resource for maintaining. 

What do you think about it?'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-04-09 01:25:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15834, 'date': '2019-04-09 04:46:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Cong: VNFM (Tacker) subscribe to AODH event alarm for any VNF that is capable of Fenix interaction. That subscription has the VNFM side VNF specific URL. Fenix does not need to know this URL as AODH sends event to that URL automatically when Fenix makes project specific "maintenance.planned" notification that triggers the alarm. By this design, VNFM can be any. Notification/event payload has a callback to know Fenix API.'}, {'account_id': 22290, 'date': '2019-04-17 08:06:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 22290, 'date': '2019-04-17 08:08:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 22290, 'date': '2019-04-17 08:10:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I only have question about the maintenance url here
 > "v1.0/vnfs/<vnf-uuid>/maintenance/<project_id>". How does Fenix
 > know this url?
 > 
 > IMO, we can put Fenix configuration in tacker.conf and then in
 > Fenix side, it can receive VNF information as it's resource for
 > maintaining.
 > 
 > What do you think about it?

Yes, we should discuss how exchange the infra or VNF data:)'}, {'account_id': 15834, 'date': '2019-04-17 08:29:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

When Tacker subscribes to AODH, it puts the URL there where it then receives the event alarm over planned.maintenance. This way Fenix does not need to know the URL. Later this might be different if the subscription will move to Fenix (not decided)'}, {'account_id': 15834, 'date': '2019-04-17 08:38:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(7 comments)'}, {'account_id': 22290, 'date': '2019-04-17 12:27:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

commit_message:
Fenix plugin for rolling upgrades in Tacker

This spec describes a Fenix plugin for rolling upgrades in Tacker

Blueprint vnf-rolling-upgrade
storyborad https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2005220

With the accompanying change in puppet-tripleo, this removes the
hardcoded firewall rule allowing ssh traffic in tripleo::firewall::pre

commit_message:
implement default ssh-from-ctlplane rule via hiera

With the accompanying change in puppet-tripleo, this removes the
hardcoded firewall rule allowing ssh traffic in tripleo::firewall::pre
and replaces it with a configuration in tripleo-firewall.yaml that
allows only ssh access from the undercloud's controlplane network
address. This allows operators to define more granular ssh
firewall rules via tripleo::firewall::firewall_rules.

Change-Id: I89cff59947dda3f51482486c41a3d67c4aa36a3e
Related-Bug: #1826829
(cherry picked from commit a433e05e669a3c77445ccf7574c9ffe9d09cf5ef)
(cherry picked from commit 123535d8c92caa8be4c19aaf64eff55f8be0c50d)

commit_message:
Implement Apache WSGI for Qinling

Since this review[1], Qinling supports WSGI execution.

From a production perspective, Qinling should be deployed
using Apache and mod_wsgi.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661851/

Change-Id: I9aaee4c2932f1e4ea9fe780a64e96a28fa6bccfb
Story: 2005920

commit_message:
Add sha256 in ceph fetch keys

fetch_ceph_keys.py is using insecure sha1 function, this patch adds
sha256 beside sha1 - in order to remove sha1 safely in U release.

Change-Id: I32ba1abd204c9dba4bbe3132b5650b0e391616af
Closes-Bug: #1826327
(cherry picked from commit 0a2dc8aa1d267da3c1c2925b3f292bd96aa50edb)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-28 19:58:50.000000000', 'message': 'Support multiple external networks in L3 agent

Change [1] removed the deprecated option external_network_bridge. Per
commit message in change [2], "l3 agent can handle any networks by
setting the neutron parameter external_network_bridge and
gateway_external_network_id to empty". So the consequence of [1] was to
introduce a regression whereby multiple external networks are not
supported by the L3 agent anymore.

This change proposes a new simplified rule. If
gateway_external_network_id is defined, that is the network that the L3
agent will use. If not and multiple external networks exist, the L3
agent will handle any of them.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/567369/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/59359

Change-Id: Idd766bd069eda85ab6876a78b8b050ee5ab66cf6
Closes-Bug: #1824571
'}, {'created': '2019-05-28 20:05:16.000000000', 'message': 'Support multiple external networks in L3 agent

Change [1] removed the deprecated option external_network_bridge. Per
commit message in change [2], "l3 agent can handle any networks by
setting the neutron parameter external_network_bridge and
gateway_external_network_id to empty". So the consequence of [1] was to

This change proposes a new simplified rule. If

Change-Id: Idd766bd069eda85ab6876a78b8b050ee5ab66cf6

(cherry picked from commit 0b3f5f429d2e495eb78d78d46186092ac735e0d5)
'}]
commit_message:
Support multiple external networks in L3 agent

Change [1] removed the deprecated option external_network_bridge. Per
commit message in change [2], "l3 agent can handle any networks by
setting the neutron parameter external_network_bridge and
gateway_external_network_id to empty". So the consequence of [1] was to
introduce a regression whereby multiple external networks are not
supported by the L3 agent anymore.

This change proposes a new simplified rule. If
gateway_external_network_id is defined, that is the network that the L3
agent will use. If not and multiple external networks exist, the L3
agent will handle any of them.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/567369/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/59359

Change-Id: Idd766bd069eda85ab6876a78b8b050ee5ab66cf6
Closes-Bug: #1824571
(cherry picked from commit 0b3f5f429d2e495eb78d78d46186092ac735e0d5)

commit_message:
[admin-guide]Replace the abandoned command with new command..

The commad "nova absolute-limits " is replaced by "nova limits" after
Ocata;The command "nova quota-update" is replaced by "openstack quota set".

Co-Authored-By: chenxing <chen.‚Äãxing@99cloud.‚Äãnet>
Change-Id: Ic857918b15496049b5ccacde9515f130cc0bd7e9
Closes-Bug: #1672430
Implements: blueprint use-openstack-command

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-18 17:39:35.000000000', 'message': 'Use td-agent-gem to install fluentd monasca plugin on ubuntu

If monasca is enabled on ubuntu, we see the following error in fluentd:

[error]: config error file="/etc/td-agent/td-agent.conf"
error_class=Fluent::ConfigError error="Unknown output plugin 'monasca'.
Run 'gem search -rd fluent-plugin' to find plugins"

This is because we use 'fluent-gem install' to install the gem, which
works on CentOS but on Ubuntu it is necessary to use 'td-agent-gem
install'.

Change-Id: I515f9764ca93a41a871e520696193a9298856d08
Closes-Bug: #1830147
(cherry picked from commit c585ca5055c7a92fdbe5826030d3529e5c397540)

commit_message:
Use td-agent-gem to install fluentd monasca plugin on ubuntu

If monasca is enabled on ubuntu, we see the following error in fluentd:

[error]: config error file="/etc/td-agent/td-agent.conf"
error_class=Fluent::ConfigError error="Unknown output plugin 'monasca'.
Run 'gem search -rd fluent-plugin' to find plugins"

This is because we use 'fluent-gem install' to install the gem, which
works on CentOS but on Ubuntu it is necessary to use 'td-agent-gem
install'.

Change-Id: I515f9764ca93a41a871e520696193a9298856d08
Closes-Bug: #1830147
(cherry picked from commit c585ca5055c7a92fdbe5826030d3529e5c397540)

commit_message:
doc: Add additional content to admin guide

Import the following documents from the admin guide [1]:

- cli-manage-flavors.rst
- cli-nova-evacuate.rst
- cli-nova-manage-projects-security.rst
- cli-nova-manage-services.rst
- cli-nova-numa-libvirt.rst
- cli-nova-specify-host.rst
- cli-set-quotas.rst
- cli-set-compute-quotas.rst
- cli-os-migrate.rst
- cli-os-migrate-cfg-ssh.rst
- ts-no-emulator-x86-64.rst
- ts-multipath-warn.rst
- ts-failed-connect-vol-FC-SAN.rst
- ts-failed-attach-vol-no-sysfsutils.rst
- ts-failed-attach-vol-after-detach.rst
- ts-vol-attach-miss-sg-scan.rst

These were missed in the original import [2]. All 'ts-' files are merged
into a single 'support-compute' document, which is already in-tree.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-manuals/tree/stable/ocata/doc/admin-guide/source
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/477497/

We'll likely discuss this more at office hours on wednesday (1500 UTC), but I suggested it might be useful to review some of the pre-ptg discussion before hand. See, for example:

* http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004782.html
* http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004787.html
* http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/005823.html"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-06-11 11:26:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I've done some experimenting on https://review.opendev.org/657510 which has been illuminating and a bit surprising (at least to me).

I started out with just gabbi and a containerized placement with the yaml that is now in gabbits/traits-flow-down-experiment.yaml in the above patch, trying to model a simple something that has resourceless contributors (with traits) as well as bad cousins (members of the tree that we don't want to impact results).

I then moved that file into the my resourceless WIP and at first it wouldn't work becuase there was an early exit in _alloc_candidates_multiple_providers if there were no rp_candidates. Skipping the filtering got things moving, and let the filtering I added in _check_traits_for_alloc_request to have enough inputs to filter things as desired.

I'm not exactly sure what we should conclude from this but it seems like useful info."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-06-11 22:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:
