subject: Add nova to global-requirements
messages:
[{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-06-05 06:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-06-05 06:37:52.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from nova to tox-siblings'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-06-05 09:00:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-06-05 11:18:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-06-05 11:32:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-06-05 14:10:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

I think we decided in denver that projects wishing to be used as libraries need to have intermediate releases.  (or preferably make a nova-lib)

What happens when those dependant projects when nova doesn't make a release for the new version in six months (they can't dev on X new feature added / changed in nova til then)."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-06-05 14:27:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Matthew, this blocks https://review.opendev.org/663251 and https://review.opendev.org/663252 - and thus changes to remove zuul-cloner from the system.

Do you have a better idea on how to do this?'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-06-05 14:49:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

There are two options, in order of prefrence...

1 make nova-lib for exportable classes/functions
1.1 used by nova and not-nova
1.2 cycle with intermediary release type

2 switch nova to cycle with intermediary

The reasoning for this is that if you use something as a library you have to treat it as one.  See what octavia is doing (making octavia-lib), we've gotten reviews to add octavia to global-reqs that have been shot down for similiar reasons (by reqs team and octavia ptl)."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-06-05 15:32:29.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-06-05 15:32:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ah, good point. The necessary bits really should be extracted into a separate lib.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-06-16 20:51:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

going to -W this to make it clear this is not the right solution (see previous comment)'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-06-23 14:37:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

see comments'}]

commit_message:
Add nova to global-requirements

A few repos - compute-hyperv and blazar-nova - need to install nova, add
it to global requirements since it's now on pypi.

Nova needs to be added to the blacklist since it has not intermediate
releases.

Change-Id: I9f26e4cd8f11b8271d69d81b8ab9c99cacacd2fb

commit_message:
Add airship/airshipctl

This adds the airshipctl command line interface, which will be used
to drive Airship operations in the Airship 2.0 target state.

Change-Id: I79abd7ee9f06cbcaec645f5da284f52566a40bb1

commit_message:
Add Active/Active HA to Support Matrix

As we are moving to get more drivers to test
Active/Active HA support we should have a column in
our support matrix to indicate this functionality.

Change-Id: If1883b0f36dbf2b8d9076db6d97a0c8914f46b85

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: I6a1a0de5af46e60b6ac10209bf235085db8af40a
Story: #2005924
Task: #34200

commit_message:
conf: Rename 'configuration drive' to 'config drive'

Keeps dansmith happy.

Change-Id: Ifd8537692de98ee02ff7333812d2877273a0a388
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-04 11:01:13.000000000', 'message': "doc: Rework 'config-drive' user doc

Make use of the oslo.config roles and some built-in Sphinx roles. We
also drag some stuff up a level.

Change-Id: I4fb2b628bd93358a752e2397ae353221758e2984
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-03-04 14:44:26.000000000', 'message': "doc: Rework 'config-drive' user doc

Make use of the oslo.config roles and some built-in Sphinx roles. We
also drag some stuff up a level.

Change-Id: I4fb2b628bd93358a752e2397ae353221758e2984
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-03-05 18:01:19.000000000', 'message': "docs: Rework all things metadata'y

Turns out we've a *lot* of disparate metadata systems. Attempt to both
link them somewhat through extensive cross-referencing and extract out
deployment-specific stuff from user-facing docs. Lots of changes here,
but in summary:

- Split out admin-focused content from the metadata API, config drive,
  user data and vendordata docs.

- Dedupe the config drive and metadata API user docs, which are mostly
  talking about the same thing

- Make use of various oslo.config and Sphinx roles

This isn't complete but it's a start, and I've already wasted the bones
of day on this.

Side note: I miss when we have tech writers to do this stuff for us :(

Change-Id: I4fb2b628bd93358a752e2397ae353221758e2984
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-03-07 16:44:25.000000000', 'message': "docs: Rework all things metadata'y

Turns out we've a *lot* of disparate metadata systems. Attempt to both
link them somewhat through extensive cross-referencing and extract out
deployment-specific stuff from user-facing docs. Lots of changes here,
but in summary:

- Split out admin-focused content from the metadata API, config drive,
  user data and vendordata docs.

- Merge the config drive, metadata service, vendordata and user-data
  user docs, which are mostly talking about the same thing and are
  fairly barren without the deployment components

- Make use of various oslo.config and Sphinx roles

Side note: I miss when we have tech writers to do this stuff for us :(

Change-Id: I4fb2b628bd93358a752e2397ae353221758e2984
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
docs: Rework all things metadata'y

Turns out we've a *lot* of disparate metadata systems. Attempt to both
link them somewhat through extensive cross-referencing and extract out
deployment-specific stuff from user-facing docs. Lots of changes here,
but in summary:

- Split out admin-focused content from the metadata API, config drive,
  user data and vendordata docs.

- Merge the config drive, metadata service, vendordata and user-data
  user docs, which are mostly talking about the same thing and are
  fairly barren without the deployment components

- Make use of various oslo.config and Sphinx roles

Side note: I miss when we have tech writers to do this stuff for us :(

Change-Id: I4fb2b628bd93358a752e2397ae353221758e2984
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28655, 'date': '2019-01-30 10:54:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 28655, 'date': '2019-01-30 11:21:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/621165/7 : SUCCESS in 1h 41m 49s'}, {'account_id': 28655, 'date': '2019-01-30 16:25:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 26925, 'date': '2019-01-30 16:51:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Hello, I was actually working on my own patch for this as well that is slightly different, but does the job. Maybe we can work together to ensure neutron metering is bug free for DVR - without breaking l3ha.

I'm actually currently testing ur patch for iptables_driver.py Alexandru Sorodoc. The other 2 files are pretty much the same for me. Trying to learn if you have something that i've missed or vice versa"}, {'account_id': 26925, 'date': '2019-01-30 17:24:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

judging from logs, your patch seems to have exact same result.

One issue we faced was there were way too many notifications sent when cloud has >500 routers. A lot of the messages started timing out.
If we can improve the code even further to only check snat namespace on network nodes, and qrouter namespace on compute nodes, rather than both on all nodes, we can reduce the number of notifications by more than half.

For example, these are the namespaces that I currently have:
controller001 | SUCCESS | rc=0 >>
snat-82c21918-16d2-4bff-993d-5ce908066e7f
qrouter-82c21918-16d2-4bff-993d-5ce908066e7f

controller002 | SUCCESS | rc=0 >>
qrouter-82c21918-16d2-4bff-993d-5ce908066e7f

compute002 | SUCCESS | rc=0 >>
qrouter-82c21918-16d2-4bff-993d-5ce908066e7f (id: 7)

controller003 | SUCCESS | rc=0 >>
qrouter-82c21918-16d2-4bff-993d-5ce908066e7f

compute001 | FAILED | rc=1 >>


It checks + send notifications for all these namespaces rather than just the 2 of interest.'}, {'account_id': 28655, 'date': '2019-01-30 18:04:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Hello, I'm happy to collaborate in fixing this problem.

Here are two bug reports that I posted a while ago regarding metering for DVR routers which explain the issues I found: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1807157 and https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1807153.
I didn't test my code with HA routers. I was hoping that it wouldn't break anything and that I would look into it whenever it would be needed.

>One issue we faced was there were way too many notifications sent when cloud has >500 routers.
By notifications you mean notifications containing packet or bytes measurements or notifications specifically related to HA routers?

>only check snat namespace on network nodes, and qrouter namespace on compute nodes
It is necessary to check the rfp interface on the qrouter namespace on compute nodes, it is responsible to routing floating ip traffic, at least for non-HA routers. I agree that it's useless to check the snat namespace on compute nodes and the qrouter namespace on network nodes for distributed routers, but I haven't found a reliable way of checking if the metering agent is running on a compute nodes or a network node (there are also all-in-one single machine deployments). Neutron has an API for querying which L3 agent is running on which node but I'm not sure if it returns the operating mode (dvr/dvr_snat) of the agent. Plus, there would have to be a mechanism for checking if the operating mode has been changed. Either a periodic check or an event listener."}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-01-30 20:16:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/621165/8 : FAILURE in 1h 39m 57s'}, {'account_id': 26925, 'date': '2019-01-30 20:34:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Here's my iptables_driver.py

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634016/1/neutron/services/metering/drivers/iptables/iptables_driver.py. The code doesn't have the race condition fix, but I didn't really see what wrong could happen if its not there - should skip the iptable rules if namespace isn't there.

we raised the heat for https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1807157, now hopefully it'll get higher priority.

>>One issue we faced was there were way too many notifications sent when cloud has >500 routers.
>By notifications you mean notifications containing packet or bytes measurements or notifications specifically related to HA routers?
By notification, i meant rabbitmq messages containing measurements for DVR.

>>only check snat namespace on network nodes, and qrouter namespace on compute nodes
>It is necessary to check the rfp interface on the qrouter namespace on compute nodes, it is responsible to routing floating ip traffic, at least for non-HA routers. I agree that it's useless to check the snat namespace on compute nodes and the qrouter namespace on network nodes for distributed routers, but I haven't found a reliable way of checking if the metering agent is running on a compute nodes or a network node (there are also all-in-one single machine deployments). Neutron has an API for querying which L3 agent is running on which node but I'm not sure if it returns the operating mode (dvr/dvr_snat) of the agent. Plus, there would have to be a mechanism for checking if the operating mode has been changed. Either a periodic check or an event listener.
What we can do is maybe call get_l3_agents_hosting_routers(), use that to check only for snat. But don't know how to find which node has qrouter namespace. Would need to check the api."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-04-16 08:48:12.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 weeks without comment, and failed Jenkins the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}, {'account_id': 28655, 'date': '2019-05-29 08:47:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 28655, 'date': '2019-05-29 08:48:19.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 28655, 'date': '2019-05-29 08:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-05-29 08:58:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Hi Alexandru:

Can you please add a bug description?

As I can see in the code and the commit message, you are trying to solve several problems in one patch. For the sake of clarity, can you submit one patch per problem? This will be easier (and faster) to be reviewed.'}, {'account_id': 28655, 'date': '2019-05-29 11:19:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> Can you please add a bug description?

I created two bug reports some time ago: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1807153 and https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1807157.

The first report described the race condition. The second report describes the problems I found with metering for DVR routers.

I can try breaking this up in 3 changes when I'll have some free time. About test failures, last time I looked into them they didn't seem related to my changes or even reproducible (some tests fail, I recheck, then other tests fail). I assumed they were caused by other things and I didn't know what to do in that case."}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-05-29 14:20:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/621165/9 : SUCCESS in 1h 40m 20s'}, {'account_id': 28655, 'date': '2019-06-22 22:01:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> Hi Alexandru:
 > 
 > Can you please add a bug description?
 > 
 > As I can see in the code and the commit message, you are trying to
 > solve several problems in one patch. For the sake of clarity, can
 > you submit one patch per problem? This will be easier (and faster)
 > to be reviewed.

I've broken this up in 6 changes:
1. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666964/
2. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666965/
3. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666966/
4. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666968/
5. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666969/
6. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666970/

I will abandon this change and wait for reviews on those 6."}, {'account_id': 28655, 'date': '2019-06-22 22:03:53.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This was broken down into 6 smaller changes.

commit_message:
Fixes metering for DVR Routers

Metering agent gets notified about DVR Routers running on compute nodes

Fixed metering for DVR routers

Fixed race condition when adding router before its namespaces are created

Fixed l3 agents on compute nodes not receiving notifications for dvr routers

Change-Id: If7f78b72fd1e1be05636c164bd559862cc3498d0

subject: Change default security group protocol to 'any'
messages:
[{'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2017-11-10 16:00:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2017-11-11 03:35:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

this seems like a big usability improvement. so +1'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-11-15 22:14:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This may indeed be a usability improvement but it is not backward-compatible, as I would argue that without changing my scripts I will get a different firewall configuration than before, and not one that I would consider to be 'safer', it is more open.

We can consider this for osc4"}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2017-11-17 04:30:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The code as it is makes osc different from the neutron client, which is a regression in my opinion.  The change to make 'tcp' the default security group protocol shouldn't have been done, and I don't believe anyone from the neutron team was involved in that decision or review.  We only get the bugs when end-users notice it.  This change happened in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/307908/ and wasn't even in the commit message."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-11-17 20:23:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I will not disagree that this is a sub-optimal situation, but I will strenuously stop any attempt to change this in a non-opt-in manner for existing users.  The fact is that this change results in a more open firewall configuration than yesterday and that is simply not acceptable.  We can fix it in OSC 4, that will be opt-in for users as a number of things will be breaking.  See the feature/osc4 branch.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2017-11-17 21:52:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I understand wanting to be backwards compatible, and the change is pretty close, I'll explain.

For example, if you assumed TCP but didn't specify, it will not work in most cases:

$ openstack security group rule create --ingress --dst-port 99 default
Error while executing command: Bad Request (HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-67d05bfd-58b3-4812-a962-260a992bb35b)

That's because if you specify a port range you must specify a protocol.  Running with --debug shows:

RESP BODY: {"NeutronError": {"message": "Must also specify protocol if port range is given.", "type": "SecurityGroupProtocolRequiredWithPorts", "detail": ""}}

So it's a regression in that users that hadn't been specifying a protocol will now get an error, which should help them fix their scripts.

The only case that's an issue is if you didn't specify any arguments at all:

$ openstack security group rule create --ingress default

That will currently let in all TCP.  With this change any protocol.  I'm not sure that's a typical situation, but I guess the one regression I could find.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2017-11-30 20:25:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-12-01 22:22:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2017-12-01 22:26:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It was merged in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/307908/ - May 2016, I don't know what version that was."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-12-02 00:15:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That was released in 2.4.0, over a year and a half ago.  My gut says we're committed, I suppose I'd like to hear more opinions.  It's the fact that this is a potential security complaint that makes it important to me to get it right.  Maybe I'm worried about a really minor thing; having some community buy-in would ease my mind.  Unless someone beats me to it I'll kick off a thread on the ops list to see how our users feel about it."}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-09-27 21:50:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Are we almost at OSC 4 time where this can merge?'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-05-01 21:21:14.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1716789 to osc4'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-05-03 20:50:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-05-03 21:07:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-05-03 21:44:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-05-03 21:47:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-05-06 14:55:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-05-06 14:55:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-05-08 08:50:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-05-08 22:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Not quite yet, we need one more 3.x release before the OSC4 bits can go in...'}, {'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2019-05-14 11:00:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28935, 'date': '2019-05-14 15:06:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-06-22 18:56:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-10 16:00:28.000000000', 'message': "Change default security group protocol to 'any'

The default protocol used to create a security rule was changed to
``tcp``, which was a regression from the neutron client.  Change it
back to ``any``, which skips sending the protocol to the API
server entirely.

Users that had been creating rules without specifying a protocol
and expecting ``tcp`` need to change to use ``--protocol tcp``
explicitly.

Change-Id: Iedaa027240e00dced551513d8fa828564386b79f
Closes-bug: #1716789
"}, {'created': '2019-05-06 14:55:38.000000000', 'message': "Change default security group protocol to 'any'

The default protocol used to create a security rule was changed to
``tcp``, which was a regression from the neutron client.  Change it
back to ``any``, which skips sending the protocol to the API
server entirely when using the Neutron v2 API.

Users that had been creating rules without specifying a protocol
and expecting ``tcp`` need to change to use ``--protocol tcp``
explicitly.

Change-Id: Iedaa027240e00dced551513d8fa828564386b79f
Closes-bug: #1716789
"}]
commit_message:
Change default security group protocol to 'any'

The default protocol used to create a security rule was changed to
``tcp``, which was a regression from the neutron client.  Change it
back to ``any``, which skips sending the protocol to the API
server entirely when using the Neutron v2 API.

Users that had been creating rules without specifying a protocol
and expecting ``tcp`` need to change to use ``--protocol tcp``
explicitly.

Change-Id: Iedaa027240e00dced551513d8fa828564386b79f
Closes-bug: #1716789

commit_message:
Cinder replace is_ceph_volume_configured

In preparation for supporting multiple Ceph backends
replace is_ceph_volume_configured with has_ceph_backend.

has_ceph_backend returns true when at least one
backend is using RBDDriver.

Change-Id: Iaa67061b05a9d355228ad7d3f5ee0f4f04dbdc66
Signed-off-by: Daniel Badea <daniel.badea@windriver.com>.

messages: [{'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2019-03-22 15:53:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2019-03-22 16:09:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:\n\nOne more note, the upgrades were actually completed about a week ago. Limestone's downstream nodepool has been utilizing this cloud all week and we have not seen network issues. We run a lot less jobs than infra, but at least a few hundred ran here this week."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-03-27 20:40:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-03-27 20:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-06-22 19:17:33.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as I5c682ab59bf570dcd3fd326a28467dc8a9ac7609'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-22 15:53:45.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Disable provider limestone"

No clear explanation has been found for the network oddities that
were being seen when this was disabled on 3/4.

However, since the cloud has been disabled, all nodes have undergone
a full dist-upgrade, OpenStack services have gone from P->Q->R, and
Ceph has been upgraded to Mimic.

All nodes have been rebooted into 4.15.0-46-generic #49~16.04.1-Ubuntu
(notating this for future reference in case nested virt issues
arise.)

Let's begin running jobs again and investigate further if the mirror
connectivity issues still persist.

This reverts commit 00c4f22ebc506ddd9bfbee1a92368e1a3f883c52.

Change-Id: I30d4d7bdb7c55a6d712487ada31b325c78fd6dc6
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Disable provider limestone"

No clear explanation has been found for the network oddities that
were being seen when this was disabled on 3/4.

However, since the cloud has been disabled, all nodes have undergone
a full dist-upgrade, OpenStack services have gone from P->Q->R, and
Ceph has been upgraded to Mimic.

All nodes have been rebooted into 4.15.0-46-generic #49~16.04.1-Ubuntu
(notating this for future reference in case nested virt issues
arise.)

Let's begin running jobs again and investigate further if the mirror
connectivity issues still persist.

This reverts commit 00c4f22ebc506ddd9bfbee1a92368e1a3f883c52.

Change-Id: I30d4d7bdb7c55a6d712487ada31b325c78fd6dc6

commit_message:
Use cliff formattable columns in network commands

Use cliff formattable columns not to convert complex fields
into a string when a machine readable format like JSON or YAML
is requested.

Partial-Bug: #1687955
Partially implement blueprint osc-formattable-columns

Change-Id: I9878f327e39f56852cc0fb6e4eee9105b7141da9

commit_message:
Cleanup: Remove deprecated role list filters

The role list command filter by project and user
was deprecated in Newton and should have been
removed in Pike. This patch removes the deprecated
both filters.

Change-Id: Iae8d2e4f999134f4785366af90b425ecdc5eff22

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-20 12:19:37.000000000', 'message': 'Maintenance task: Fix race condition at resource creation

When the maintenance task runs (every 5 minutes) it should take in
consideration how old is the resource before considering it to be an
inconsitency.

Prior to this patch, what could happen is that a resource being created
was committed to the neutron database but not yet to the OVN database and
ovn_revision_numbers cache table. In the meantime, the maintenance
task could run and create that resource before the create_*_postcommit()
completed resulting in a race condition.

Using a port as an example, the following error would be seeing when
that happens (more detailed example in the LP ticket):

ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl.transaction [-] OVSDB Error:
{"details":"Transaction causes multiple rows in \"Logical_Switch_Port\"
table to have identical values (\"89ebd403-68af-43a2-a4e4-5fa86d57d2a2\")
for index on column \"name\".

This patch adds a new filter to the get_inconsistent_resources() method
which checks the "created_at" column of the resource to see if it's older
than 180 seconds (3 minutes) and ignore if it's newer.

Closes-Bug: #1833445
Change-Id: If157e9d4660cc6c566ecad44aa6734af2bd14db1
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-06-20 16:02:42.000000000', 'message': 'Maintenance task: Fix race condition at resource creation

When the maintenance task runs (every 5 minutes) it should take in
consideration how old is the resource before considering it to be an
inconsitency.

Prior to this patch, what could happen is that a resource being created
was committed to the neutron database but not yet to the OVN database and
ovn_revision_numbers cache table. In the meantime, the maintenance
task could run and create that resource before the create_*_postcommit()
completed resulting in a race condition.

Using a port as an example, the following error would be seeing when
that happens (more detailed example in the LP ticket):

ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl.transaction [-] OVSDB Error:
{"details":"Transaction causes multiple rows in \"Logical_Switch_Port\"
table to have identical values (\"89ebd403-68af-43a2-a4e4-5fa86d57d2a2\")
for index on column \"name\".

This patch adds a new filter to the get_inconsistent_resources() method
which checks the "created_at" column of the resource to see if it's older
than 60 seconds and ignore if it's newer.

Closes-Bug: #1833445
Change-Id: If157e9d4660cc6c566ecad44aa6734af2bd14db1
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Maintenance task: Fix race condition at resource creation

When the maintenance task runs (every 5 minutes) it should take in
consideration how old is the resource before considering it to be an
inconsitency.

Prior to this patch, what could happen is that a resource being created
was committed to the neutron database but not yet to the OVN database and
ovn_revision_numbers cache table. In the meantime, the maintenance
task could run and create that resource before the create_*_postcommit()
completed resulting in a race condition.

Using a port as an example, the following error would be seeing when
that happens (more detailed example in the LP ticket):

ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl.transaction [-] OVSDB Error:
{"details":"Transaction causes multiple rows in \"Logical_Switch_Port\"
table to have identical values (\"89ebd403-68af-43a2-a4e4-5fa86d57d2a2\")
for index on column \"name\".

This patch adds a new filter to the get_inconsistent_resources() method
which checks the "created_at" column of the resource to see if it's older
than 60 seconds and ignore if it's newer.

Closes-Bug: #1833445
Change-Id: If157e9d4660cc6c566ecad44aa6734af2bd14db1
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

Some manual testing in devstack for this patch:

1. bad microversion:

stack@devstack:~/nova$ openstack server lock --reason "should fail" test-vm-devstack2-8
--os-compute-api-version 2.73 or greater is required to support the reason option.

2. good microversion:

stack@devstack:~/nova$ openstack --os-compute-api-version 2.73 server lock --reason "my reason" test-vm-devstack2-8
stack@devstack:~/nova$ openstack --os-compute-api-version 2.73 server show test-vm-devstack2-8 | grep lock
| locked                              | True                                                                                               |
| locked_reason                       | my reason

3. filter server list - bad microversion

stack@devstack:~/nova$ openstack server list --locked
--os-compute-api-version 2.73 or greater is required to support the (un)locked filter option.

stack@devstack:~/nova$ openstack server list --unlocked
--os-compute-api-version 2.73 or greater is required to support the (un)locked filter option.

4. filter server list - good microversion

stack@devstack:~/nova$ openstack --os-compute-api-version 2.73 server list --locked

commit_message:
Microversion 2.73: Support adding the reason behind a server lock

This patch adds a new parameter ``--reason`` to ``openstack server lock``
command and ``--locked``, ``unlocked`` filtering parameters to
``openstack server list`` command. This can help users to provide a
reason when locking the server and to filter instances based on their
locked value from 2.73 microversion.

Implements blueprint add-locked-reason
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661785/

Change-Id: Ib2714f98b24d47e570da8a6c231e765acd2ff595

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-20 22:07:40.000000000', 'message': "Add functional recreate test for regression bug 1825537

Change I2d9ab06b485f76550dbbff46f79f40ff4c97d12f in Rocky
(and backported through to Pike) added error handling to
the resize_instance and finish_resize methods to revert
allocations in placement when a failure occurs.

This is OK for resize_instance, which runs on the source
compute, as long as the instance.host/node values have not
yet been changed to the dest host/node before RPC casting
to the finish_resize method on the dest compute. It's OK
because the instance is still on the source compute and the
DB says so, so any attempt to recover the instance via hard
reboot or rebuild will be on the source host.

This is not OK for finish_resize because if we fail there
and revert the allocations, the instance host/node values
are already pointing at the dest compute and by reverting
the allocations in placement, placement will be incorrectly
tracking the instance usage with the old flavor against the
source node resource provider rather than the new flavor
against the dest node resource provider - where the instance
is actually running and the nova DB says the instance lives.

This change adds a simple functional regression test to
recreate the bug with a multi-host resize. There is already
a same-host resize functional test marked here which will
need to be fixed as well.

Change-Id: Ie9e294db7e24d0e3cbe83eee847f0fbfb7478900
Related-Bug: #1825537

commit_message:
Add functional recreate test for regression bug 1825537

Change I2d9ab06b485f76550dbbff46f79f40ff4c97d12f in Rocky
(and backported through to Pike) added error handling to
the resize_instance and finish_resize methods to revert
allocations in placement when a failure occurs.

This is OK for resize_instance, which runs on the source
compute, as long as the instance.host/node values have not
yet been changed to the dest host/node before RPC casting
to the finish_resize method on the dest compute. It's OK
because the instance is still on the source compute and the
DB says so, so any attempt to recover the instance via hard
reboot or rebuild will be on the source host.

This is not OK for finish_resize because if we fail there
and revert the allocations, the instance host/node values
are already pointing at the dest compute and by reverting
the allocations in placement, placement will be incorrectly
tracking the instance usage with the old flavor against the
source node resource provider rather than the new flavor
against the dest node resource provider - where the instance
is actually running and the nova DB says the instance lives.

This change adds a simple functional regression test to
recreate the bug with a multi-host resize. There is already
a same-host resize functional test marked here which will
need to be fixed as well.

Change-Id: Ie9e294db7e24d0e3cbe83eee847f0fbfb7478900
Related-Bug: #1825537

commit_message:
Add zuul-jobs roles to job job that uses them

Job openstack-helm-infra uses role named "start-zuul-console" that is part
of another project named "zuul/zuul-jobs". If this job is
ever used by another project as "parent job", it would fail, because
wouldn't find the role in any of the default pathes. This patch adds the
roles from zuul/zuul-jobs project, to the job that uses these roles from
the project

Change-Id: Ib3b7e0e43008b7a4f394b49b75529bfde9780d2f

- When using the TLS certificate generation macro, optionally
  support base64 encoding values for direct inclusion in a Kubernetes

  compatibility.

Change-Id: Ib62af4e5738cbc853a18e0d2a14c6103784e7370
'}, {'created': '2019-06-22 10:12:49.000000000', 'message': '(helm-toolkit) Optionally b64 encode TLS keys

commit_message:
(helm-toolkit) Optionally b64 encode TLS keys

- When using the TLS certificate generation macro, optionally
  support base64 encoding values for direct inclusion in a Kubernetes
  secret. The default is to maintain current behavior for backward
  compatibility.

Change-Id: Ib62af4e5738cbc853a18e0d2a14c6103784e7370

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-21 20:41:53.000000000', 'message': 'Do not require a CLA for the sandbox

The sandbox repo is in opendev/ in order to be a place for any
OpenDev project to point new contributors at in order to become
familiar with the system.  OpenDev does not require a CLA in general,
so the sandbox repo should not either.

Change-Id: I4de78dbc0b5ed6c9d311bcd14ff6a0d214409ce0
'}]
commit_message:
Do not require a CLA for the sandbox

The sandbox repo is in opendev/ in order to be a place for any
OpenDev project to point new contributors at in order to become
familiar with the system.  OpenDev does not require a CLA in general,
so the sandbox repo should not either.

Change-Id: I4de78dbc0b5ed6c9d311bcd14ff6a0d214409ce0

commit_message:
Clean Zuul repo mirrors for RHEL family

- unify RDO mirror definition with others
- drop definitions of unused mirrors: grafana, elastic
- clean up the process of mirror substitution:
  - actually OracleLinux and CentOS do not differ here at all
    and in fact never should (both are RHEL-based after all)
  - use the more common style of sed d command
  - uncomment baseurl globally

Change-Id: I1fe045e63757ebf8e83d86778e435fabcd892f11
Signed-off-by: Rados≈Çaw Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Update some URLs to latest
3. Update the UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for tox[1]

[1]: refer to  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/006478.html

Change-Id: Id095cbd60f5a11f25a64f37b18393afbd4b4262c

commit_message:
Add centos_yum_repos_to_disable overridable in base

[1] disabled CentOS Ceph Nautilus repo for Stein.
It turned out to be a problem for TripleO ([2])
which does not use upstream Ceph repo and actually
relies on CentOS Ceph Nautilus repo.
We did not leave the option to override our customization.
This patch implements it in stable/stein.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/651601
[2] https://review.opendev.org/664244

Change-Id: Ie268bb875b774a9bafd04f8c27c63b2b35dee5c8
Signed-off-by: Rados≈Çaw Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 867556b13cf17f24477822368333bdcfb21c9dd0)

commit_message:
Use Ansible to configure the Hiera config

Replace the Heat resources which used to manage the hiera config file
and now use Ansible with the new tripleo-hieradata role.

Remove {{server_resource_name}}Deployment and
{{server_resource_name}}Config resources not needed anymore.

Change-Id: I88fe3460af93b83cc086afeb1c2b959bbb720470
implements: blueprint reduce-deployment-resources
Depends-On: Ia5f11ea1a2f16b736ed7053c5182c7f5a7eb1f4b

commit_message:
Remove deprecated volume commands and args

The following were deprecated over two years ago and can now be removed:

* Remove ``backup`` commands in favor of ``volume backup``
* Remove ``snapshot`` commands in favor of ``volume snapshot``
* Remove ``volume create`` options ``--project``, ``--user`` and ``--multi-attach``
* Use of an auth-key positional argument in volume transfers
* ``volume transfer request`` no longer accepts 'auth_key' as a positional arg,
  ``--auth-key`` is now required

Internal (non-user-visible)
* Rename backup.py to volume_backup.py for Volume v1 and v2, update tests

These are backwards incompatible changes and will require a major
version bump after they are merged.

Change-Id: I94aa7a9824e44f9585ffb45e5e7637b9588539b4
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2019-06-20 14:04:38.000000000', 'message': 'Force --hostonly when regenerating the initramfs

The dracut-config-generic package (sometimes installed by default in
the overcloud image) provides a configuration file that turns off the
host-specific initramfs generation with dracut:

$ cat /usr/lib/dracut/dracut.conf.d/02-generic-image.conf
hostonly="no"

The result is that the generated initrams does not contain:

- /etc/systemd/journald.conf
- /etc/systemd/system.conf
- /etc/hostname
- /etc/machine-id
- /etc/vconsole.conf
- /etc/locale.conf
- /etc/modules-load.d/*.conf
- /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
- /etc/sysctl.conf

Especially problematic is the absence of sysctl.conf when ipv6 is
disabled via "KernelDisableIPv6: 1" because we end up half-disabling
ipv6 and services like rpbcind end up in failed state.

Original issue: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1830574

This commit builds on top of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661528/
adding the '--hostonly' option to dracut so to bypass 'hostonly="no"'
eventually contained in the default config file.

Change-Id: Ia4a39721268fe9bb0fdcc8bf4eb148263d4df46e
'}, {'created': '2019-06-21 21:38:25.000000000', 'message': 'Force --hostonly when regenerating the initramfs

- /etc/modules-load.d/*.conf
- /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
- /etc/sysctl.conf

Especially problematic is the absence of sysctl.conf when ipv6 is
disabled via "KernelDisableIPv6: 1" because we end up half-disabling
ipv6 and services like rpbcind end up in failed state.

Original issue: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1830574

This commit builds on top of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661528/
adding the '--hostonly' option to dracut so to bypass 'hostonly="no"'

Change-Id: Ia4a39721268fe9bb0fdcc8bf4eb148263d4df46e
'}]
commit_message:
Force --hostonly when regenerating the initramfs

The dracut-config-generic package (sometimes installed by default in
the overcloud image) provides a configuration file that turns off the
host-specific initramfs generation with dracut:

$ cat /usr/lib/dracut/dracut.conf.d/02-generic-image.conf
hostonly="no"

The result is that the generated initrams does not contain:

- /etc/systemd/journald.conf
- /etc/systemd/system.conf
- /etc/hostname
- /etc/machine-id
- /etc/vconsole.conf
- /etc/locale.conf
- /etc/modules-load.d/*.conf
- /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
- /etc/sysctl.conf

Especially problematic is the absence of sysctl.conf when ipv6 is
disabled via "KernelDisableIPv6: 1" because we end up half-disabling
ipv6 and services like rpbcind end up in failed state.

Original issue: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1830574

This commit builds on top of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661528/
adding the '--hostonly' option to dracut so to bypass 'hostonly="no"'
eventually contained in the default config file.

Change-Id: Ia4a39721268fe9bb0fdcc8bf4eb148263d4df46e

commit_message:
Change cred-cleanup to not restart on failure

When cleaning up an entire openstack deployment, it's possible
that mariadb will be deleted prior to keystone, and as a result
keystone-credential-cleaup hook will not be able to run. This
blocks the cleanup from occuring successfully.

This change sets the keystone-credential-cleanup hook to run
"post-delete" and the pod restart policy to "Never". If
the mariadb deployment is gone, this hook is unneeded.

Change-Id: I7e2e4680e35fb243488e707cf5a4a26e05433913

commit_message:
Add per-release project templates for build containers jobs

This review adds per-release containers build templates
to be used when making changes on repositories which do not have
branches.

commit_message:
Update DPDK docs with note about using veth pairs

In case when ovs-dpdk is used together with ``ovs_use_veth`` config
option set to True, it cause invalid checksum on all packets send from
qdhcp namespace.
This commit adds short info about this limitation to ovs-dpdk config
guide.

Change-Id: I6237abab3d9e625440e95e75f5091d09a1ec44f0
Related-Bug: #1832021

commit_message:
Simplfy test setup for TestNovaMigrations* tests

The NoDBTestCase base class does a lot of env setup that is not needed
for these tests. As we have issues with these tests (see bug 1823251)
this patch tries to decrease the complexity of them to help the
troubleshooting.

Change-Id: I46fafa470b9d378d96c0f364e9b487742bf58cb2
Related-Bug: #1823251

'}, {'created': '2019-06-11 17:01:56.000000000', 'message': "Use Ansible for {{server_resource_name}}Deployment

Use the new tripleo-hieradata Ansible role to configure
the remaining Hieradata files that were created by Heat before.

{{server_resource_name}} isn't yet fully converted to Ansible, and
another patch will remove the resource when Ansible controls the
hiera.yaml file in /etc/puppet/hieradata.

Change-Id: Ib946b566d66300d23e7abc12498cc11d3f5fa5f8
Depends-On: I0556e788be1a898ab26934a660273bb6134f35e6

commit_message:
Use Ansible for {{server_resource_name}}Deployment

Use the new tripleo-hieradata Ansible role to configure
the remaining Hieradata files that were created by Heat before.

{{server_resource_name}} isn't yet fully converted to Ansible, and
another patch will remove the resource when Ansible controls the
hiera.yaml file in /etc/puppet/hieradata.

Change-Id: Ib946b566d66300d23e7abc12498cc11d3f5fa5f8
implements: blueprint reduce-deployment-resources

commit_message:
Fix plugin doc generation for opendev transition

Update the server to opendev and update paths for gitea, along with
any other references.

Switch to a blacklist where we just remove stackforge; this leaves all
the new namespaces like x/ and starlingx/ being checked.

Use a common session for checking for the plugin file which makes it a
*lot* faster.

Remove unsed "plugins" array variable

Regenerate the file

Change-Id: Ie3e615ba352a389da22e129c5c67cf6abd8cfdc8

commit_message:
Clarify --before help text in nova manage

The --before option to nova manage db purge and archive_deleted_rows
accepts a string to be parsed by dateutils.parser.parse() with
fuzzy=True. This is fairly forgiving, but doesn't handle e.g. "now - 1
day". This commit adds some clarification to the help strings, and some
examples to the docs.

Change-Id: Ib218b971784573fce16b6be4b79e0bf948371954

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-12 15:41:37.000000000', 'message': 'Add server add/remove volume description for microversion 2.20

The compute API 2.20 microversion allows attaching and detaching
a volume to/from a server with status SHELVED or SHELVED_OFFLOADED.
For OSC this just means the user has to specify the appropriate
minimum microversion to make that work, so this change mentions
that in the "server add volume" and "server remove volume" command
description.

Related to nova blueprint volume-ops-when-shelved

Change-Id: I4824175e5d9e124e3bd9e9a8fd5a89277efc6cff
'}]
commit_message:
Add server add/remove volume description for microversion 2.20

The compute API 2.20 microversion allows attaching and detaching
a volume to/from a server with status SHELVED or SHELVED_OFFLOADED.
For OSC this just means the user has to specify the appropriate
minimum microversion to make that work, so this change mentions
that in the "server add volume" and "server remove volume" command
description.

Related to nova blueprint volume-ops-when-shelved

Change-Id: I4824175e5d9e124e3bd9e9a8fd5a89277efc6cff

commit_message:
Remove deprecated network options

The following were deprecated for several releases and can now be
removed:

* Remove ``port create|set`` options ``--device-id`` and ``--port-id``
* Remove ``router set`` option ``--clear-routes``
* Remove ``security group rule create`` options ``--src-group`` and ``--src-ip``

These are backwards incompatible changes and will require a major
version bump after they are merged.

Change-Id: Ieae74c14f6b3e263721a3146cf76f94a9ab792f6
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove deprecated identity commands and args

The following were deprecated over two years ago and can now be
removed/changed:

* Remove ``service create`` option ``--type``
* Remove ``role list`` options ``--project`` and ``--user``
* Remove ``user role list`` command

These are backwards incompatible changes and will require a major
version bump after they are merged.

Change-Id: I29e2fc9516dffbfd83eef0bc91e834dde99b4105
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove deprecated compute commands

The following were deprecated over two years ago and can now be removed:

* ``ip fixed add|remove`` in favor of ``server add|remove fixed ip``
* ``ip floating add|remove`` in favor of ``server add|remove floating ip``

These are backwards incompatible changes and will require a major
version bump after they are merged.

Change-Id: I10c4d32a3c0b55ad41a02afd3b14249bafcb55a9
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
TrivialFixes to networking-ovn repo

- Debug logging information is added to
get_candidates_for_scheduling() to provide more information when no
chassis information is available for a physnet.
- Use the chassisredirect constant from networking_ovn.common.constants

Change-Id: Ie4a4bbcdd1e2619fc6830bf86eeb37604d91c49a

[{'created': '2018-11-07 18:51:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix iDRAC SpanLength issue during raid creation

iDRAC driver complains and fails about SpanLength during RAID provisioning.

The reason is because Ironic returns a float instead of an int and iDRAC
doesn't like that.

Value returns should not be 2.0 for 2 for example.

Change-Id: Iada6266f4080082591a354a08e6fb60f1fb670f7
Task:  27804
Story: 2004265
"}]
commit_message:
Fix iDRAC SpanLength issue during raid creation

iDRAC driver complains and fails about SpanLength during RAID provisioning.

The reason is because Ironic returns a float instead of an int and iDRAC
doesn't like that.

Value returns should not be 2.0 for 2 for example.

Change-Id: Iada6266f4080082591a354a08e6fb60f1fb670f7
Task:  27804
Story: 2004265

[diskimage-create] Fix qemu-utils package name

There is no package qemu in Ubuntu, the package name is qemu-utils.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-20 19:19:31.000000000', 'message': 'Replace bootstrap_nodeid with SERVICE_short_bootstrap_node_name

This solves the problem that bootstrap_nodeid, which is set to the
first node in each role via t-h-t, can match potentially more than
one node - e.g in the event that a service is deployed such that it
spans more than one role.

The SERVICE_short_bootstrap_node_name is automatically generated
based on the composable service template service_name, and this
considers all roles where the service is enabled, e.g it should
only evaluate true once regardles off the roles where the service
is enabled.

Change-Id: I48ec4549552910f3cb8db960b0ff10a6c61b4bb9
Partial-Bug: #1792613
(cherry picked from commit 9cde9139c4f2a59e6fca765e87ffce42cf7da696)

commit_message:
Replace bootstrap_nodeid with SERVICE_short_bootstrap_node_name

This solves the problem that bootstrap_nodeid, which is set to the
first node in each role via t-h-t, can match potentially more than
one node - e.g in the event that a service is deployed such that it
spans more than one role.

The SERVICE_short_bootstrap_node_name is automatically generated
based on the composable service template service_name, and this
considers all roles where the service is enabled, e.g it should
only evaluate true once regardles off the roles where the service
is enabled.

Change-Id: I48ec4549552910f3cb8db960b0ff10a6c61b4bb9
Partial-Bug: #1792613
(cherry picked from commit 9cde9139c4f2a59e6fca765e87ffce42cf7da696)

[{'created': '2018-10-26 19:38:38.000000000', 'message': "Remove PKI/PKIZ support

Keystone server no longer supports PKI/PKIZ. This change removes
keystonemiddleware's support of PKI/PKIZ and associated code.

commit_message:
Remove PKI/PKIZ support

Keystone server no longer supports PKI/PKIZ. This change removes
keystonemiddleware's support of PKI/PKIZ and associated code.

Change-Id: I9a6639a2aa3774be61972d57f38220f66fd5c0e8
closes-bug: #1649735
partial-bug: #1736985

(12:50:50 PM) artom: mriedem, so https://review.opendev.org/#/c/522106/ can be abandoned
(12:53:06 PM) mriedem: artom: not really
(12:53:11 PM) mriedem: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/581410/ isn't really describing scheduler hints in detail,
(12:53:21 PM) mriedem: it's just describing scheduler hints vs flavor extra specs
(12:53:28 PM) mriedem: which is more of an admin/operator thing than end user
(12:53:57 PM) artom: mriedem, are we reading the same first paragraph of https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/scheduler-hints-vs-flavor-extra-specs.html#scheduler-hints?
(12:54:01 PM) mriedem: i agree the in-tree hints are described now in the api-ref
(12:54:18 PM) mriedem: artom: i wrote https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/scheduler-hints-vs-flavor-extra-specs.html#scheduler-hints?
(12:54:43 PM) artom: mriedem, I know - it's almost word for word as what's in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/522106/8/api-guide/source/server_concepts.rst, no?
(12:55:16 PM) artom: OK, maybe not word for word
(12:55:47 PM) mriedem: i think the api-guide would benefit from (1) a short description of what are scheduler hints, (2) an example api request, and then (3) links to the thing above (hints vs extra specs) and the server create api reference for the description of the available in-tree hints
(12:56:05 PM) mriedem: our api-ref doesn't have a sample with a scheduler hint in 
(12:56:07 PM) mriedem: *it
(12:56:16 PM) mriedem: so every time i write a test that uses one, i have to look this up
(12:56:54 PM) mriedem: b/c 1. there are 2 param names accepted for hints and 2. it's at the top level of the request rather than within the server object"}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-06-13 18:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-06-14 06:32:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
api-guide: better explain scheduler hints.

This patch explains what scheduler hints are, gives an example
request, then links to the api-ref for details.

Co-Authored-By: Artom Lifshitz <alifshit@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I1c55b9a17e9d9f57d9ec1383680cccb6ae7fcfaf

commit_message:
Release notes for dns_domain behavioural changes

As part of the fix for bug 1826419, a prior release note was
deleted and no new release note was added to document the
change in behaviour as a result of upgrading.

Restore deleted release note in the stable branches,
the new note will be added in the master branch.

Change-Id: Ic668d64c28cdc1068cb2413b09839a127bad46d3

subject: Update wait for pod script
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 17591, 'name': 'Steve Wilkerson', 'email': 'wilkers.steve@gmail.com', 'username': 'srwilkers'}, {'_account_id': 21420, 'name': 'Gage Hugo', 'email': 'gagehugo@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghugo'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23928, 'name': 'Pete Birley', 'email': 'petebirley@gmail.com', 'username': 'portdirect'}, {'_account_id': 28372, 'name': 'chinasubbareddy mallavarapu', 'email': 'cr3938@att.com', 'username': 'chinasubbareddy'}, {'_account_id': 29974, 'name': 'Stephen Taylor', 'email': 'stephen.taylor.1@att.com', 'username': 'st053q'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 28372, 'date': '2019-06-20 21:07:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28372, 'date': '2019-06-20 22:26:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2019-06-21 16:00:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Doesnt permitting 'init' as a state nullify the functionality of this script?"}, {'account_id': 28372, 'date': '2019-06-21 17:03:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Doesnt permitting 'init' as a state nullify the functionality of
 > this script?
Agree with you Pete , but this script is so fast to come out if we delete a pod and its not waiting for new pod to come into running state.
we need to rerun the script to catch new pod .
please let me know if there is a  best way to handle this .

steps to reproduce:
1. delete a pod like ceph-osd in ceph namespace
2. run this script to wait for all pods in ceph namespace ."}, {'account_id': 29974, 'date': '2019-06-21 17:24:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > Doesnt permitting 'init' as a state nullify the functionality of
 > > this script?
 > Agree with you Pete , but this script is so fast to come out if we
 > delete a pod and its not waiting for new pod to come into running
 > state.
 > we need to rerun the script to catch new pod .
 > please let me know if there is a  best way to handle this .
 > 
 > steps to reproduce:
 > 1. delete a pod like ceph-osd in ceph namespace
 > 2. run this script to wait for all pods in ceph namespace .

We have the same problem in the ceph-osd orchestrator with a ceph-osd pod restart causing peering which we want to wait for before moving on. If we check too quickly it appears to have finished because it hasn't started yet. We solved this problem there by initiating a 2-phase wait. The first phase waits until peering is seen, then the second phase waits until it isn't seen anymore. Can a similar approach be used here?"}, {'account_id': 28372, 'date': '2019-06-21 20:57:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > > Doesnt permitting 'init' as a state nullify the functionality
 > of
 > > > this script?
 > > Agree with you Pete , but this script is so fast to come out if
 > we
 > > delete a pod and its not waiting for new pod to come into running
 > > state.
 > > we need to rerun the script to catch new pod .
 > > please let me know if there is a  best way to handle this .
 > >
 > > steps to reproduce:
 > > 1. delete a pod like ceph-osd in ceph namespace
 > > 2. run this script to wait for all pods in ceph namespace .
 > 
 > We have the same problem in the ceph-osd orchestrator with a
 > ceph-osd pod restart causing peering which we want to wait for
 > before moving on. If we check too quickly it appears to have
 > finished because it hasn't started yet. We solved this problem
 > there by initiating a 2-phase wait. The first phase waits until
 > peering is seen, then the second phase waits until it isn't seen
 > anymore. Can a similar approach be used here?

agree with pete here that handling init containers is not scope of this script."}, {'account_id': 28372, 'date': '2019-06-21 20:57:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Update wait for pod script

This is to  enhance the script to wait for init pods  and pods in
terminating or initilization phases as slow environments may take
some time in both the cases.

Change-Id: Icb389372761be94dda05bbd7843eaaa2ae240f81

commit_message:
Patch fluentd module for unit tests until code lands

The fluentd tdagent provider is currently wrapped in parser function
rather than just being defined normally. We have a proposed patch to the
main module, but until that time let's pull the fix in for the unit
testing. We don't actually consume this provider in tripleo so it
doesn't affect deployment and only shows up in unit testing.

Change-Id: I73c7e73d3c4f77fcb93bca54157031db0a548b61
Closes-Bug: #1833724

commit_message:
tripleo-hieradata: add hieradata_files param

If hieradata_files is set (must be a list), Ansible will configure
/etc/puppet/hiera.yaml with the right configuration for Hiera.

Note: we now use hiera3 for backward compatibility but in the future we
will switch to hiera5.

Change-Id: Ia5f11ea1a2f16b736ed7053c5182c7f5a7eb1f4b
implements: blueprint reduce-deployment-resources

subject: Use sorted dictionary before iteration
messages: [{'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-06-21 09:39:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2019-06-21 13:24:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-06-21 18:13:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-21 09:39:21.000000000', 'message': 'Use sorted dictionary before iteration

In Python 3, dict.values() method returns a view of the dictionary's
values but in a different order than Python 2, which returns a
list. This patch sorts the data dictionary first to be sure to get the
same order whatever the Python version.

In Python 3.3 "abstract base classes" in collections (like Mapping or
Sequence) were moved to second-level module collections.abc. So in
Python 3.3+ the real type is collections.abc.Mapping and so
on. Documentation states that the old alias
names (e.g. collections.Mapping) will be available up to Python
3.7 (currently the latest version), however in 3.8 these aliases will be
removed. This patch prepares the code to the future Python 3.8 version.

This patch also fixes the warnings and errors lists to get only unique
messages.

Change-Id: If2c22ad982fafc37ef48b7cd870ea6cf01e7913a
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 90bb5816015f8e4c9d7a44731e2e133429463487)
'}]
commit_message:
Use sorted dictionary before iteration

In Python 3, dict.values() method returns a view of the dictionary's
values but in a different order than Python 2, which returns a
list. This patch sorts the data dictionary first to be sure to get the
same order whatever the Python version.

In Python 3.3 "abstract base classes" in collections (like Mapping or
Sequence) were moved to second-level module collections.abc. So in
Python 3.3+ the real type is collections.abc.Mapping and so
on. Documentation states that the old alias
names (e.g. collections.Mapping) will be available up to Python
3.7 (currently the latest version), however in 3.8 these aliases will be
removed. This patch prepares the code to the future Python 3.8 version.

This patch also fixes the warnings and errors lists to get only unique
messages.

Change-Id: If2c22ad982fafc37ef48b7cd870ea6cf01e7913a
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 90bb5816015f8e4c9d7a44731e2e133429463487)

commit_message:
PowerMax docs - add information on new and existing functionality

Adding more information on the PowerMax support of cinder backup and
links to the latest documentation.  Adding note on support of in use
(attached) volume retyping and Unisphere failover feature.

Change-Id: I1dfc0b32a152b43f52328eab9a5d50faa991113b
(cherry picked from commit c2c084da77c2387a61191881076ad5bfe4a9491a)

commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Adding new fields to scheduler data

NetApp SolidFire now reports new fields to the scheduler. Those fields
will allow operators to consider QoS and efficiency rates in the
filtering and weighing of volumes.

Implements: blueprint sf-qos-on-scheduler-stats
Change-Id: Id77b532187ecd5f3f42171f1f94b6f0246d07be5

[{'created': '2019-06-19 20:00:43.000000000', 'message': "Release notes for dns_domain behavioural changes

As part of the fix for bug 1826419, a prior release note was
deleted and no new release note was added to document the
change in behaviour as a result of upgrading.

Restore deleted release note and add new release note to
detail the behaviour of {network,conf}.dns_domain with
respect to the DHCP agent post upgrade. The restored note
is marked as 'ignore' since it originally appeared in Stein
and will be restored there on a subsequent cherry-pick.

commit_message:
Release notes for dns_domain behavioural changes

As part of the fix for bug 1826419, a prior release note was
deleted and no new release note was added to document the
change in behaviour as a result of upgrading.

Restore deleted release note in the stable branches,
the new note will be added in the master branch.

Change-Id: Ic668d64c28cdc1068cb2413b09839a127bad46d3
Related-Bug: 1826419

commit_message:
Re-enable internal DNS tests

Re-enable internal DNS tests as assocaited Neutron
changes have now landed.

Assert that 'starwars' has not been configured in
the search path for the test instance.

Related-Bug: 1826419
Change-Id: I9d16f3b2dacd1e753c8f9d803c889c537a3f3378

commit_message:
[Ceph] Implement pool quotas on pools as they are created/managed

This patch set implements pool quotas on each pool in the Ceph
cluster by obtaining the total capacity of the cluster in bytes,
multiplying that by the defined percentage of total data expected
to reside in each pool and by the cluster quota, and setting a
byte quota on each pool that is equal to its expected percentage
of the total cluster quota.

Change-Id: I1686822a74c984e99e9347f55b98219c47decec1

commit_message:
Limit interval between retries to 1 minute

Currently it grows exponentially, exceeding 1 hour after 15 retries.
While we don't expect people to have so many retries, we should not
let them shoot their legs.

Change-Id: I01dfaa1c379340a0d41fcfdb07298fdef6110941

commit_message:
[Ceph] Modify CRUSH map for changes to existing deployments

This adds the ability for the ceph-osd osd-directory.sh script to
handle existing deployments that place data in hosts via CRUSH and
modify those deployments to place data in racks instead. The
existing data remains intact but is redistributed across the new
rack-level failure domains by updating the CRUSH map and assigning
new rules to existing pools.

Change-Id: Ida79f876d0cae3d99e796e4de1aac55a7978986c

[{'created': '2019-06-14 16:05:19.000000000', 'message': 'Increase TestDhcpAgentHA.agent_down_time to 30 seconds

Currently there is a delay (around 20 seconds) between the the agent
update call and the server reply, due to the testing servers load. This
time should be higher than the agent-server communication delay but
still short enough to detect when the DHCP agent is dead during the
active wait during the DHCP agent network rescheduling.

"log_agent_heartbeats" is activated to add information about when the
server has processed the agent report status call. This log will allow
to check the different between the server updating time and the previous
agent heartbeat timestamp.

commit_message:
Increase TestDhcpAgentHA.agent_down_time to 30 seconds

Currently there is a delay (around 20 seconds) between the the agent
update call and the server reply, due to the testing servers load. This
time should be higher than the agent-server communication delay but
still short enough to detect when the DHCP agent is dead during the
active wait during the DHCP agent network rescheduling.

"log_agent_heartbeats" is activated to add information about when the
server has processed the agent report status call. This log will allow
to check the different between the server updating time and the previous
agent heartbeat timestamp.

Change-Id: Icf9a8802585c908fd4a70d0508139a81d5ac90ee
Related-Bug: #1799555

I made the changes pointed out since I wanted to pull this down and test it locally in a devstack environment but otherwise everything looks OK to me.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-20 18:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Ah crap I broke one of the unit tests, sec.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-20 18:39:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-20 19:00:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-20 19:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Doing some manual testing, I've got 5 fake computes (single node devstack) and created a server on devstack4.

Tried migrating to devstack1 with both the --live and --host options and that fails as expected:

$ openstack server migrate --live devstack1 --host devstack1 --wait test-vm
usage: openstack server migrate [-h] [--live-migration]
                                [--live <hostname> | --host <hostname>]
                                [--shared-migration | --block-migration]
                                [--disk-overcommit | --no-disk-overcommit]
                                [--wait]
                                <server>
openstack server migrate: error: argument --host: not allowed with argument --live


Tried cold migrating to devstack1 but with microversion 2.1 (default) which fails as expected:

$ openstack server migrate --host devstack1 --wait test-vm
--os-compute-api-version 2.56 or greater is required to use --host without --live-migration.


Trying to use --live-migration and --host before 2.30 fails as expected:

$ openstack server migrate --live-migration --host devstack1 --wait test-vm
--os-compute-api-version 2.30 or greater is required when using --host


Using v2.30, live migrated to devstack1:

stack@devstack:~$ openstack --os-compute-api-version 2.30 server migrate --live-migration --host devstack1 --wait test-vm
Complete
stack@devstack:~$ openstack server show test-vm | grep ":host"
| OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host                | devstack1                                                       |
stack@devstack:~$ 


Cold migrate back to devstack4 by specifying the host and using v2.56 works:

stack@devstack:~$ openstack --os-compute-api-version 2.56 server migrate --host devstack4 --wait test-vm
Complete
stack@devstack:~$ openstack server show test-vm | grep ":host"
| OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host                | devstack4                                                       |
stack@devstack:~$ openstack server show test-vm | grep status
| status                              | VERIFY_RESIZE                                                   |
stack@devstack:~$ 


So this all looks good to me, just need to fix that one error message.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-20 19:14:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-20 19:14:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-20 19:14:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

LGTM and manual testing notes are within the comments.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-06-21 14:48:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Published edit on patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-06-21 14:48:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

I added a lstory link to the release note...'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-06-21 15:56:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1'}]

Currently doing a "server migrate" (without "--live") while specifying a
target host is not possible however nova api supports it since version
2.56.

This patch allows passing "--host" to "server migrate". This patch
depends on the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627801/ which is a
breaking change so it's not expected this patch will make it until osc4
or later.

Change-Id: I960109008096ce8bb4e4c8ca6ffb22c33aacd995

commit_message:
Allow "server migrate" (not live) to take "--host" option

Currently, doing a cold migration while specifying a target host is not
possible however nova api supports it since version 2.56.

This patch allows passing "--host" when doing a cold migration.
It runs normally if --os-compute-api-version is 2.56 or greater and
returns an error otherwise.

Change-Id: I960109008096ce8bb4e4c8ca6ffb22c33aacd995
Story: 2003325
Task: 24359

[{'created': '2019-06-12 15:25:16.000000000', 'message': "Add server event command documentation for compute API 2.21

The 2.21 compute API microversion allows listing instance
action events and getting action event details for a deleted
server (which can be useful for auditing until the deleted
server is purged). As far as OSC is concerned it's just a
matter of specifying --os-compute-api-version 2.21 or higher
when listing events or showing event details, so this change
mentions 2.21 in the description of those commands.

Related to nova blueprint os-instance-actions-read-deleted-instances

Change-Id: If276c794f448b6fa5b0845499f3507a159acab85
"}]
commit_message:
Add server event command documentation for compute API 2.21

The 2.21 compute API microversion allows listing instance
action events and getting action event details for a deleted
server (which can be useful for auditing until the deleted
server is purged). As far as OSC is concerned it's just a
matter of specifying --os-compute-api-version 2.21 or higher
when listing events or showing event details, so this change
mentions 2.21 in the description of those commands.

Related to nova blueprint os-instance-actions-read-deleted-instances

Change-Id: If276c794f448b6fa5b0845499f3507a159acab85

commit_message:
Remove non-ASCII quotes in metadata.yaml

LP: #1334482 and LP: #1832605 summarize the issue.

Until the larger problem is fixed we can fix the immediate one by not
using Unicode quotes in metadata.yaml.

Change-Id: I21249679ac9aa107c0bede96a07e5d6e0b7218a8
Closes-Bug: #1832605

commit_message:
Adds job that runs molecule tests

Enable testing roles with molecule via tox-molecule job.

Its first version only tried to run tripleo-bootstrap role on two
supported platforms.

Test locally by running `tox -e molecule` or
`pytest path/to/molecule.yml` if you have pytest-molecule installed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663599/
Change-Id: I27157c439aea5ca6bda2e2d9070644ef7bb23a9d

commit_message:
Retry heat stack polling on gateway problems

If the heat api is overloaded or temporarily unavailable, we might get a
503 or 504 from haproxy during the deployment. We should retry polling
for events in this case as to not prematurely exit the deployment.

Change-Id: I947cd0f9bf4a97e46c3d2bf3e9b986f7d38e9357
Closes-Bug: #1833452
(cherry picked from commit cb42cfe30fb0ca8f95ae3e7d93e616c106c6c191)

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Update some URLs to latest
3. Remove unncessary "=="

Change-Id: I5fe3be557f9bc3cc1f8faae198df93ed4ed2bc97

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary openldap-clients package from overcloud controllers

We currently install the openldap-clients package on overcloud
controller nodes.  It was assumed that this package was needed for
IPA client enrollment, but the ipa-client package only uses the
openldap libraries that will already be pulled in as an indirect
dependency of ipa-client.  The openldap-clients package contains
LDAP CLI utilities, which don't appear to be actually used.

Change-Id: I14c1d8204bd84ead0d6995b5aefd10d2bbc4227d
(cherry picked from commit 34e1c75e54c7d059c2530a5f6f03bb7a9e9f4d86)
(cherry picked from commit d0eb1d93967c2b1f41aadca74538c9b5674687ba)
(cherry picked from commit 5f4cb7d604a63dd317964b1b8133229e519bbaa1)

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary openldap-clients package from overcloud controllers

We currently install the openldap-clients package on overcloud
controller nodes.  It was assumed that this package was needed for
IPA client enrollment, but the ipa-client package only uses the
openldap libraries that will already be pulled in as an indirect
dependency of ipa-client.  The openldap-clients package contains
LDAP CLI utilities, which don't appear to be actually used.

Change-Id: I14c1d8204bd84ead0d6995b5aefd10d2bbc4227d
(cherry picked from commit 34e1c75e54c7d059c2530a5f6f03bb7a9e9f4d86)
(cherry picked from commit d0eb1d93967c2b1f41aadca74538c9b5674687ba)

I would think a release note would be friendly to let people know that it has been added. Is the general osprofiler documentation sufficient or should we add something to the placement docs as well.

The -1 is for the naming conflict mentioned within."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-06-12 21:02:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> 2) is it back-portable to stable

both wsgi.py and deploy.py haven't changed a ton, so from that standpoint a backport should be fine.

I'm personally fine with it being backported but it would be useful to hear from mriedem if it fits the stable-backport logic. I would think it probably does since though it is essentially a feature, it's tooling that would generally have been expected to be there for "mature" or required services.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-06-13 12:08:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-06-13 12:21:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-06-14 08:39:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-06-14 11:38:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-06-14 11:39:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-06-17 11:10:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-19 18:22:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-19 18:26:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

FWIW I remember adding osprofiler to the nova-generated config sample and docs:

I28d35165ed77487cd49d560fb1eda4f1d640734e

Not sure if that's something we'd want to do here as well but it's probably going to be hard without some documentation somewhere in placement that osprofiler integration works."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-06-20 13:37:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-20 13:43:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-06-20 13:47:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> FWIW I remember adding osprofiler to the nova-generated config
 > sample and docs:
 > 
 > I28d35165ed77487cd49d560fb1eda4f1d640734e
 > 
 > Not sure if that's something we'd want to do here as well but it's
 > probably going to be hard without some documentation somewhere in
 > placement that osprofiler integration works.

Somewhere earlier in the stack I said "Is the general osprofiler documentation sufficient or should we add something to the placement docs as well." If it is I think that's probably enough. If you want to use osprofiler you're gonna go there and find out what you need to do to your service to run it.

If you don't want to use osprofiler, or don't care about it, then having it in sample config is something akin to noise.

If we had (and we probably should) a placement doc which described "tools you can use to analyse, manage and otherwise inspect your placement service" then a link to the osprofiler docs would make a ton of sense.

But I don't reckon we should let that hold this up, unless we're scared it will never happen, or my paragraph beginning "Somewhere..." is missing some key point.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-20 13:53:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Published edit on patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-20 13:53:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I fixed the typo in the release note and opened task https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/task/34191 for tracking any documentation work, otherwise cdent was +2 and this lgtm.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-06-20 21:34:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck rax mirror'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-06-21 07:42:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

"}, {'created': '2019-06-12 17:39:19.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for osprofiler in wsgi

To use osprofiler with placement:

* Add a [profiler] section to the placement.conf (and other openstack
  service conf files):

  [profiler]
  connection_string = mysql+pymysql://root:admin@127.0.0.1/osprofiler?charset=utf8
  hmac_keys = my-secret-key
  trace_sqlalchemy = True
  enabled = True

* Include the hmac_keys in your API request

  $ openstack server create --flavor c1 --image cirros-0.4.0-x86_64-disk \
    --os-profile my-secret-key vm --wait

  The openstack client will return the trace id:

  Trace ID: 67428cdd-bfaa-496f-b430-507165729246
  $

* Extrace the trace in html format

  $ osprofiler trace show --html 67428cdd-bfaa-496f-b430-507165729246 \
    --connection-string mysql+pymysql://root:admin@127.0.0.1/osprofiler?charset=utf8

Here is an example trace output for the above server create request
including the placement interactions enabled by this patch:
https://pste.eu/p/ZFsb.html

Story: 2005842
Task: 33616

Change-Id: I5a0e805fe04c00c5e7cf316f0ea8d432b940e560
