commit_message:
Add support for osprofiler in wsgi

To use osprofiler with placement:

* Add a [profiler] section to the placement.conf (and other openstack
  service conf files):

  [profiler]
  connection_string = mysql+pymysql://root:admin@127.0.0.1/osprofiler?charset=utf8
  hmac_keys = my-secret-key
  trace_sqlalchemy = True
  enabled = True

* Include the hmac_keys in your API request

  $ openstack server create --flavor c1 --image cirros-0.4.0-x86_64-disk \
    --os-profile my-secret-key vm --wait

  The openstack client will return the trace id:

  Trace ID: 67428cdd-bfaa-496f-b430-507165729246
  $

* Extrace the trace in html format

  $ osprofiler trace show --html 67428cdd-bfaa-496f-b430-507165729246 \
    --connection-string mysql+pymysql://root:admin@127.0.0.1/osprofiler?charset=utf8

Here is an example trace output for the above server create request
including the placement interactions enabled by this patch:
https://pste.eu/p/ZFsb.html

Story: 2005842
Task: 33616

Change-Id: I5a0e805fe04c00c5e7cf316f0ea8d432b940e560

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-14 20:14:55.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - Allow devs to modify images with Python directories

This will allow dev to update their container images from a local Python
directory, example in /home/joe/git/openstack/heat.

The new parameter python_dir is a list of directories.

To use it, your playbook must be like:

commit_message:
Allow devs to modify images with Python directories

This will allow dev to update their container images from a local Python
directory, example in /home/joe/git/openstack/heat.

The new parameter python_dir is a list of directories.

To use it, your playbook must be like:

    - hosts: localhost
      connection: local
      tasks:
      - name: dev install heat-api
        import_role:
          name: tripleo-modify-image
        vars:
          tasks_from: dev_install.yml
          source_image: docker.io/tripleomaster/centos-binary-heat-api:current-tripleo
          modified_append_tag: -devel
          python_dir:
            - /home/joe/git/openstack/heat

Change-Id: I182c3fa58dc9af870e0da9f51ae1e22aa90d03e5

messages:
[{'account_id': 30598, 'date': '2019-06-21 00:48:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-06-21 00:48:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 30598, 'date': '2019-06-21 00:51:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-06-21 13:25:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-06-21 13:26:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Change-Id: Iffb232212e0a952538f95f54ccd55b68737e99e1
Signed-off-by: Mihai Plasoianu <m.plasoianu@vertical.de>
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve symlinks when copying undercloud.conf to container.

If undercloud.conf is a symlink, the mistral-executor
container crashes. This change adds "local_follow: true",
which fixes the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1833635
Change-Id: Iffb232212e0a952538f95f54ccd55b68737e99e1
Signed-off-by: Mihai Plasoianu <m.plasoianu@vertical.de>

commit_message:
Cleanup RP and HM records while deleting a compute service.

Currently when deleting a nova-compute service via the API, we will
(soft) delete the service and compute_node records in the DB, but the
placement resource provider and host mapping records will be orphaned.
This patch deletes the resource provider and host_mapping records
before deleting the service/compute node.

Change-Id: I7b8622b178d5043ed1556d7bdceaf60f47e5ac80
Closes-Bug: #1756179
(cherry picked from commit 589c495c1ae62129e20ab5e2641e330541eee01f)
(cherry picked from commit dede2de2bd482d0378a7acd81b65d93b1635e825)
(cherry picked from commit 9fe847bdca39627b4d1741d2c5807ebca7101d2e)

commit_message:
Use Resource layer for the compute Hypervsors and Images

- add query params for Hypervisors
- cleanup ImageDetail and HypervisorDetail
- mark compute.images API as deprecated
- use resource layer for hypervisors from cloud layer

Change-Id: I64988e3b978b74bd095845d4ee0e5aab4f5acf95

commit_message:
[docs] remove deprecated ubuntu package from installation

keystone package depends already on apache2 and wsgi package:

keystone
  Depends: adduser
 |Depends: apache2
  Depends: <httpd>
    tntnet
    aolserver4-core
    aolserver4-daemon
    apache2
    ebhttpd
    lighttpd
    micro-httpd
    mini-httpd
    nginx-core
    nginx-extras
    nginx-full
    nginx-light
    webfs
    yaws
  Depends: libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3
  Depends: python3-keystone
  Depends: ssl-cert
[...]

Change-Id: I1332df34dd6ee59537d35d93d5c35c2fe96561b2
Related-Bug: #1825111

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-20 19:39:43.000000000', 'message': 'Replace bootstrap_nodeid with SERVICE_short_bootstrap_node_name

This solves the problem that bootstrap_nodeid, which is set to the
first node in each role via t-h-t, can match potentially more than
one node - e.g in the event that a service is deployed such that it
spans more than one role.

The SERVICE_short_bootstrap_node_name is automatically generated
based on the composable service template service_name, and this
considers all roles where the service is enabled, e.g it should
only evaluate true once regardles off the roles where the service
is enabled.

Change-Id: I48ec4549552910f3cb8db960b0ff10a6c61b4bb9
Partial-Bug: #1792613
(cherry picked from commit 9cde9139c4f2a59e6fca765e87ffce42cf7da696)

commit_message:
Replace bootstrap_nodeid with SERVICE_short_bootstrap_node_name

This solves the problem that bootstrap_nodeid, which is set to the
first node in each role via t-h-t, can match potentially more than
one node - e.g in the event that a service is deployed such that it
spans more than one role.

The SERVICE_short_bootstrap_node_name is automatically generated
based on the composable service template service_name, and this
considers all roles where the service is enabled, e.g it should
only evaluate true once regardles off the roles where the service
is enabled.

Change-Id: I48ec4549552910f3cb8db960b0ff10a6c61b4bb9
Partial-Bug: #1792613
(cherry picked from commit 9cde9139c4f2a59e6fca765e87ffce42cf7da696)

Could you put an example config file in the etc/watcher/?'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2019-05-31 03:34:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2019-05-31 05:51:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Could you put an example config file in the etc/watcher/?

Do you mean in the commit message, in the code or in the /etc/watcher/ folder?

Since the content of the /etc/watcher folder is generated by tox  and the content is in the gitignore.'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2019-05-31 06:08:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > Could you put an example config file in the etc/watcher/?
 > 
 > Do you mean in the commit message, in the code or in the
 > /etc/watcher/ folder?
 > 
 > Since the content of the /etc/watcher folder is generated by tox 
 > and the content is in the gitignore.

I mean you put a example file in https://github.com/openstack/watcher/tree/master/etc/watcher.
It's a reference for others.
thanks!"}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2019-05-31 06:17:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > > Could you put an example config file in the etc/watcher/?
 > >
 > > Do you mean in the commit message, in the code or in the
 > > /etc/watcher/ folder?
 > >
 > > Since the content of the /etc/watcher folder is generated by tox
 > > and the content is in the gitignore.
 > 
 > I mean you put a example file in https://github.com/openstack/watcher/tree/master/etc/watcher.
 > It's a reference for others.
 > thanks!

I think it would be unwise to put an example file in this folder because the content is auto generated. It would provide another thing to maintain that is not common in other OpenStack components. 

Instead I want to dedicate a page of documentation on all the different configuration parameters Grafana uses and how to configure them to match your production environment and be able to use Grafana datasource effectively. I think this would be a better way to provide the much needed documentation around using Grafana."}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2019-05-31 08:23:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > > > Could you put an example config file in the etc/watcher/?

 > >

 > 
 > I think it would be unwise to put an example file in this folder
 > because the content is auto generated. It would provide another
 > thing to maintain that is not common in other OpenStack components.
 > 
 > Instead I want to dedicate a page of documentation on all the
 > different configuration parameters Grafana uses and how to
 > configure them to match your production environment and be able to
 > use Grafana datasource effectively. I think this would be a better
 > way to provide the much needed documentation around using Grafana.

The content in etc/watcher isn't auto generated, but if you can add help doc, it's same for me, thanks"}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2019-06-18 07:12:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2019-06-19 09:41:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-06-19 13:42:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'mark@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23851, 'name': 'Riccardo Pittau', 'email': 'elfosardo@gmail.com', 'username': 'elfosardo'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-06-18 16:49:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-06-18 16:51:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-06-18 19:51:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-06-18 21:04:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-06-20 08:18:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-06-21 13:11:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Looks like a couple commits, at least "Remove deprecated option [DEFAULT]enabled_drivers" removes functionality. Would 13.0.0 be more appropriate?'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-06-21 13:45:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Looks like a couple commits, at least "Remove deprecated option
 > [DEFAULT]enabled_drivers" removes functionality. Would 13.0.0 be
 > more appropriate?

I've spoken to Julia about this. She said that that particular config option did not work in Stein, and that the other removed options are quite minor things. Bumping to a new major version would require us to go back and rewrite release notes and the web API version history, and pull in changes merged since the referenced commit. It would also result in two major versions of ironic in the Train cycle.

How strongly do you feel about it?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-06-21 14:12:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

OK, that's good enough for me. Just wanted to make sure the version made sense for what end users could expect from this release. Thanks for the explanation!"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-06-21 14:13:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow

Oh, still should have PTL or liaison ack.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-06-21 14:13:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1

More coffee obviously needed as this has both. Please ignore me. :]'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-06-21 14:19:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks!'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-19 10:51:37.000000000', 'message': 'Add more debug information TestNeutronServer

The test cases implemented calling "_test_restart_service_on_sighup",
mock the service "start" function. This function appends a temporary
file and this file is read by the main to check the correctness of
the service and workers executing.

In case of failure waiting for the file to be created and populated,
the main function will report now:
- If the file was not created.
- The current size of the file, compared to the expected one (the number
  of times the "start" function was called)

The polling time to check the status of the file was increased to 1
second.

Change-Id: I68452408920ad9a1ee7252dd9012f898ddfa7e09
Related-Bug: #1833279
'}, {'created': '2019-06-19 22:17:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add more debug information TestNeutronServer

In case of failure waiting for the file to be created and populated,
the main function will report now:

The polling time to check the status of the file was increased to 1

Change-Id: I68452408920ad9a1ee7252dd9012f898ddfa7e09

commit_message:
Add more debug information TestNeutronServer

The test cases implemented calling "_test_restart_service_on_sighup",
mock the service "start" function. This function appends a temporary
file and this file is read by the main to check the correctness of
the service and workers executing.

In case of failure waiting for the file to be created and populated,
the main function will report now:
- If the file was not created.
- The current size of the file, compared to the expected one (the number
  of times the "start" function was called)

The polling time to check the status of the file was increased to 1
second.

Change-Id: I68452408920ad9a1ee7252dd9012f898ddfa7e09
Related-Bug: #1833279

infoblox subordinate charm.

commit_message:
Add support for Infoblox IPAM configuration via subordinate charm.

This change adds infoblox-api relation which allows neutron-server
to publish events to a remote infoblox server. Additionally this
change enables IPAM for the neutron service, which forces neutron
to authorize any network changes against the target Infoblox
server.

This change adds the proper hooks, context, and templates to add
infobox configuration to /etc/neutron/neutron.conf, passed by the
infoblox subordinate charm.

Closes-Bug: 1776689

Change-Id: Ib11377bd61c2b3fed5104ba0a423073a15cc18a2

commit_message:
Use <launchSecurity> element when SEV is required

<launchSecurity> enables use of SEV. Two related configuration values are
extracted from domain capabilities and set to the element.

Change-Id: Idb9102e73f8bda2634318d81ec4f1e0cd79d5401
blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

commit_message:
[stable-only] Make the low-constraints work and update software version

Now this style can't make low-constraints.txt work, because the pip
will constrain a library to the first item it encounters.
According to http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/006478.html:

So we need put UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE in deps.

This patch combines the changes of the following two patch:
1. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/647726/
2. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/645609/

Change-Id: I50322575f00978c989b62736ae2695eccd02d2c3

commit_message:
Fix allocate_and_associate DB deadlock

In testing we saw a DB deadlock in allocate_and_associate.
This patch corrects that with a DB retry wrapper.

Change-Id: I20572505e448f9b7ff6314b5167cc4c519c445fb
Story: 2005893
Task: 33751
(cherry picked from commit 0eaab450c12e33f277c31098a6792421d3f5806c)

devstack script that were added/changed
in order to support UEFI/GRUB2 booting
in CI.

commit_message:
Use fake flavor instead of empty dict in test

Some memorybacking tests used dict as one of the arguments to test
_get_guest_memory_backing_config, although the expected argument is
an instance of Flavor.

It does not cause failures now because extra specs or flavor is not
used in the codepath being tested. This is part of preparation for
SEV-related work.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

Change-Id: Id7e0f46b54b1dce1a0e2241b78af0e88fcf6466c

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Remove unncessary "=="

Change-Id: Id733fe1f513e756eb7bb2e8314bdb5dacc5dacd3

commit_message:
Install DIB binary dependencies from bindep.txt

This patch will ensure DIB binary dependencies are installed at an early
phase of deployment. As result, we prevent DIB from failing due to unmet
binary dependencies later on while building amphora images as seen in
[1].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/81/600381/9/check/octavia-v2-dsvm-\
scenario-fedora-latest/ced40d4/controller/logs/dib-build/amphora\
-x64-haproxy.qcow2_log.txt.gz#_2019-01-18_23_15_52_244

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/630889
Change-Id: I6b7244b6a1398994d1c537f358086e22d1e781c1

commit_message:
fs027: use ansible_hostname for host resolution

In I6425499e5d248e6cb2285f14dd9c6e716122b90b we used the
ansible_hostname fact, not the FQDN. It worked because on most of the
public clouds where TripleO CI is running, the fqdn is the hostname but
it's not the case for OVH. Let's re-use the same fact to make sure the
resolution works fine and the deployment can be done without error.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666589/
Change-Id: Ie85d841184a81f58e3dae748db93b233f770735b
Closes-Bug: #1833233

[{'created': '2019-05-30 18:46:38.000000000', 'message': "Remove unnecessary openldap-clients package from overcloud controllers

We currently install the openldap-clients package on overcloud
controller nodes.  It was assumed that this package was needed for
IPA client enrollment, but the ipa-client package only uses the
openldap libraries that will already be pulled in as an indirect
dependency of ipa-client.  The openldap-clients package contains
LDAP CLI utilities, which don't appear to be actually used.

Change-Id: I14c1d8204bd84ead0d6995b5aefd10d2bbc4227d
(cherry picked from commit 34e1c75e54c7d059c2530a5f6f03bb7a9e9f4d86)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary openldap-clients package from overcloud controllers

We currently install the openldap-clients package on overcloud
controller nodes.  It was assumed that this package was needed for
IPA client enrollment, but the ipa-client package only uses the
openldap libraries that will already be pulled in as an indirect
dependency of ipa-client.  The openldap-clients package contains
LDAP CLI utilities, which don't appear to be actually used.

Change-Id: I14c1d8204bd84ead0d6995b5aefd10d2bbc4227d
(cherry picked from commit 34e1c75e54c7d059c2530a5f6f03bb7a9e9f4d86)

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Update some URLs to latest
3. Remove unncessary "=="

Change-Id: I1d57841c754169a3d770ab3d856a95874f68f4ba

commit_message:
Ignore false positive Bandit test

Improvements[1] to the B105 hardcoded_password_string[2] test in Bandit
result in it now catching a false positive. Add a # nosec comment to
skip Bandit testing of that line.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/386
[2] https://bandit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/b105_hardcoded_password_string.html

Change-Id: I822526a7dbdd9be51edefaf6b24011fcce6e4121

commit_message:
Add asterisk mark for the required field on CreateNamespaceForm

on Create Namespace Form in metadata defs panel,
the metadef_file and direct_input is not required,
but if we not input, an error was shown.

This patch Add asterisk mark for the required field

Change-Id: I796b1516b5ce95eebe0c7cb066460f1e21a07cc9
Closes-Bug: #1831197

commit_message:
Remove credential sharing with nova

Various authtoken parameters are shifted up from the role defaults of
ironic, neutron, and placement so that nova can authenticate as these
services rather than itself when connecting to them as an API client.

Nova's configuration has been modififed not to require credential
sharing, so it will authenticate as itself to reach other APIs as
a client.

Depends-On: I021f85fd4d08e49876377f87a5cd2fddf54a236f
Change-Id: Ibc68c6b89821e6e4905d16a9115a9e42284cb0ec

subject: py3: Port the tempurl middleware
messages:
[{'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2019-04-16 07:01:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-04-16 21:05:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)

Huh. Do we have unit tests for non-ASCII paths? I didn't find them quickly...

I *know* we have functional ones -- I really want to get that chain landed :-/"}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-05-14 23:32:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-05-14 23:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-05-17 17:23:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-05-17 20:34:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

I got func tests passing after cherry-picking this onto the chain... but I had to fix up get_tempurl_keys_from_metadata to do it. IDK whether it's better to swap out get_valid_utf8_str for wsgi_to_str, or to have _prep_headers_to_info be the one running headers and value through wsgi_to_str, but something ought to change.

The prefix issue didn't come up in func tests, but we probably ought to fix it regardless."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-05-23 00:33:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-05-23 00:34:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-05-23 00:37:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Got func tests happy and even added a TestTempurlPrefixUTF8 class. I think I'm happy with it, though I still have some reservations around memcache."}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-05-24 22:23:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Hold on a second, let me re-fix this. Should take a few minutes.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-05-24 22:33:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

(1 comment)

I think I'd be happier if someone (possibly but not necessarily me) looked into what we're storing in memcached on py2 vs py3."}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-05-24 22:44:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-05-24 22:46:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-05-30 11:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-05-30 11:01:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

this probably needs to be merged with https://review.opendev.org/662115'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-05-30 19:43:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
py3: Port the tempurl middleware

This patch ports the tempurl middleware over to PY3. We use
an "all-native" string model, where we convert WSGI strings
as soon as we see them. It helps to deal with HMAC.

Aaand, we fix formpost along the way. It _clearly_ was
doing a wrong thing, encoding the same body several times
if we had several keys. On py2 it wasn't noticeable, but
on py3 this breaks, because the bytes type cannot be encoded
again.

Change-Id: I69974cc8a39731c980b54137b799a36b2e63a44a

commit_message:
Update misleading comment about fernet credential encryption

If credential keys are over-rotated, the credentials will be
unrecoverable. Also clarify the usage of fernet for tokens and the
usage of fernet for credential encryption.

Change-Id: I539769bc4af0bfa04112cbfd0fccd6b78b4e7c87

commit_message:
Fix dnf repoquery regression

Fixed issue identified at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/664872/1 which
prevented full execution of yum_update.sh on dnf platforms because
`dnf repoquery` returned exit code 1 when repo did not exist.

Change-Id: I86918f292b6863d6cb0e4fd16e62409a7f9fa80a

commit_message:
Fix network pool deletion method

This patch ensures that available_ports_pools dict structure is not
modified to be a list when ports are deleted while running the
network pool deletion method. This ensures further iterations on that
dict will not fail.

Closes-Bug: 1832838
Change-Id: I6f19724fe0dabc00d4fae5097301f7ab46a91483

In Python 3, dict.values() method returns a view of the dictionary's
values but in a different order than Python 2, which returns a
list. This patch sorts the data dictionary first to be sure to get the
same order whatever the Python version.

In Python 3.3 "abstract base classes" in collections (like Mapping or
Sequence) were moved to second-level module collections.abc. So in
Python 3.3+ the real type is collections.abc.Mapping and so
on. Documentation states that the old alias
names (e.g. collections.Mapping) will be available up to Python
3.7 (currently the latest version), however in 3.8 these aliases will be
removed. This patch prepares the code to the future Python 3.8 version.

This patch also fixes the warnings and errors lists to get only unique
messages.

Change-Id: If2c22ad982fafc37ef48b7cd870ea6cf01e7913a
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Use sorted dictionary before iteration

In Python 3, dict.values() method returns a view of the dictionary's
values but in a different order than Python 2, which returns a
list. This patch sorts the data dictionary first to be sure to get the
same order whatever the Python version.

In Python 3.3 "abstract base classes" in collections (like Mapping or
Sequence) were moved to second-level module collections.abc. So in
Python 3.3+ the real type is collections.abc.Mapping and so
on. Documentation states that the old alias
names (e.g. collections.Mapping) will be available up to Python
3.7 (currently the latest version), however in 3.8 these aliases will be
removed. This patch prepares the code to the future Python 3.8 version.

This patch also fixes the warnings and errors lists to get only unique
messages.

Change-Id: If2c22ad982fafc37ef48b7cd870ea6cf01e7913a
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

I rechecked because even though zuul had not posted results, I did not see it running in zuul.  So I assume it must have gotten stuck somehow.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-10-23 11:20:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2018-10-23 14:09:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2018-10-23 14:10:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2018-10-23 14:16:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(3 comments)

Nate: Thank you for looking at it.

Maybe based on the discussion we had on the last neutron performance meeting this is not going to be the base for later work. But now I'm intrigued and I want to learn how devstack-gate works, so I'll try to get this functioning. Maybe it'll be useful for Slawek's rally job too."}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-10-23 15:48:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/611835/7 : SUCCESS in 1h 37m 34s'}, {'account_id': 17120, 'date': '2018-10-23 20:18:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

job is getting triggered, good start Bence !'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2018-10-24 12:44:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2018-10-24 12:51:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

(3 comments)

I'm starting to understand that I was mixing up how legacy and non-legacy devstack gate jobs expect modifications to local.conf. Plus I wasn't looking at the right log files. Therefore I didn't notice ps3 was already mostly working."}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2018-10-24 13:01:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-10-24 14:19:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/611835/8 : SUCCESS in 1h 34m 12s'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2018-10-24 16:14:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Yep, it works and enables osprofiler, for example see this neutron.conf:

http://logs.openstack.org/35/611835/8/check/neutron-tempest-linuxbridge-osprofiler/bd98f30/logs/etc/neutron/neutron.conf.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-10-25 15:56:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Should I see an extra file get created for the osprofiler run, constituting the osprofiler result data? I looked around in [1] and I did not see such a file at first glance.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/35/611835/8/check/neutron-tempest-linuxbridge-osprofiler/bd98f30/'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-10-25 21:40:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2018-10-26 15:21:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> Should I see an extra file get created for the osprofiler run,
 > constituting the osprofiler result data? I looked around in [1] and
 > I did not see such a file at first glance.
 > 
 > [1] http://logs.openstack.org/35/611835/8/check/neutron-tempest-linuxbridge-osprofiler/bd98f30/

At some point yes, but I'm not there yet.

There's a long todo list here, which I better start writing down:

* DONE Enable osprofiler in devstack.
* TODO Use an api client that knows about osprofiler and enables tracing of some or all API calls (this could be rally or tempest).
* TODO When we know which client we want to use we can also decide which gate job to use as a base.
* TODO We should probably turn this job from a check job into an experimental job.
* TODO Make the trace info available for download in some format (either by generating trace reports via the osprofiler cli tool or making the redis tracepoint db available directly - the latter probably makes sense only if we have the rally report too).

Maybe we want to break these things into multiple smaller changes.

This change as it is in ps8, enables osprofiler in devstack, but then no API call is traced at all yet."}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-10-26 16:55:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: -Code-Review

Ah!  So how should we judge whether this change is working properly then?'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2019-06-21 08:52:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

We decided to integrate osprofiler with rally instead.'}]

commit_message:
Avoid unnecessary joins in delete_resource_provider

If cascade=True, we're getting all of the instances on the
compute node just to use the uuid, which will by default
join on the info_cache and security_groups for the instances.
This is a simple optimization to avoid those unnecessary joins.

A TODO is left to further optimize this with a new InstanceList
query method to just get the instance uuids on a given host/node
combo, but that requires an RPC change which we can't backport.

commit_message:
Fix installing tempest plugins

When running stack.sh locally on stable branches
with tempest enabled and TEMPEST_PLUGINS set,
devstack will try to fetch master branch of requirements
and that fails if branch is not tracked.

Change-Id: Ia1ae6869a8fede2af5cd7c875e0946b6a75eb518
Closes-Bug: #1820051
(cherry picked from commit bcd8a50cc688ee39b4b998efe959e35c4c5b1408)

'}, {'created': '2019-01-16 00:22:40.000000000', 'message': 'Install from bindep.txt in plugins

This allows plugins to specify their binary dependencies in bindep
format.

Some thinking on the implementation: this is in contrast to the
files/[deb|rpm] installation, which is called from the external
install_prereqs.sh script.  This script being an externally callable
entry-point is really an artifact of the days when we would build
snapshot images for CI and wanted to pre-cache downloads.  These days
we use the mirror system to keep packages close to CI nodes.  Thus
rather than expand install_prereqs.sh to also be installing
virtualenvs and python dependencies, this seems to fit better as a
separate internal phase of stack.sh.

Documentation is updated

Change-Id: Icbdfbf97c17c906a7ae86f43e80eb2c445816228
'}]
commit_message:
Install from bindep.txt in plugins

This allows plugins to specify their binary dependencies in bindep
format.

Some thinking on the implementation: this is in contrast to the
files/[deb|rpm] installation, which is called from the external
install_prereqs.sh script.  This script being an externally callable
entry-point is really an artifact of the days when we would build
snapshot images for CI and wanted to pre-cache downloads.  These days
we use the mirror system to keep packages close to CI nodes.  Thus
rather than expand install_prereqs.sh to also be installing
virtualenvs and python dependencies, this seems to fit better as a
separate internal phase of stack.sh.

Documentation is updated

Change-Id: Icbdfbf97c17c906a7ae86f43e80eb2c445816228

commit_message:
Make create_or_update_agent agent_timestamp optional

Argument "agent_timestamp" in
"neutron.db.agents_db.AgentDbMixin.create_or_update_agent" should
be optional to keep the compatibility with other projects implementing
ML2Plugins and using this method.

Change-Id: I8380fb824280ece16c75bb2f746c68fa8ffd160d
Closes-Bug: #1833589

commit_message:
Add setting of placement microversion on tempest conf

Tempest not support placement microversion setting so that
test can call APIs with specific placement microversion.

This commit adds the setting of placement API microversion on
Tempest conf.

Change-Id: Ie04aa993ec7a1495740d9267b076a40f4291e25e

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Update some URLs to latest
3. Update the UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for tox[1]

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/006478.html

Change-Id: Ief1980f0ff6c13ff0370b22267f2ef9baaa1ab64

commit_message:
Quote the hiera dot notation

With puppet 5, dots mean something special in hiera. You can still use
hiera lookups with dots but you need to quote the key part.

https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/5.4/hiera_automatic.html#hiera-dotted-notation

Change-Id: I94831c09821f519b81016f943a251a5b12d72750
(cherry picked from commit 526d040c397a69c5a173ae7ded1295bda16d296d)

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Remove unncessary "=="

Change-Id: I86e633512de5e35384f8dc7aa0b29a1fc07aef97

commit_message:
Fix configuration doc block formatting

Many of the code blocks in the configuration documentation had extra
leading spaces. This resulted in the blocks being both code block
formatted as well as blockquoted in the output.

This patch removes leading spaces and some minor cleanup to get the
formatted output correct.

Change-Id: Ic4dfb49c547d51e16b673bc88d7b2b1a907e3258
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2019-06-17 23:50:10.000000000', 'message': 'Disable iscsi.service to avoid iscsid on host from getting started

When some stale shutdown happens on the node, iscsi.service detects
remaining information about iscsi connection, and recovers connections
based on the information, with starting iscsid service on host.
This causes a collision between iscsid on host and iscsid in container,

Closes-Bug: #1833019
(cherry picked from commit 0d67ecaf75d9375e2a88479514ce6cb7e910ec5e)

commit_message:
Disable iscsi.service to avoid iscsid on host from getting started

When some stale shutdown happens on the node, iscsi.service detects
remaining information about iscsi connection, and recovers connections
based on the information, with starting iscsid service on host.
This causes a collision between iscsid on host and iscsid in container,
which makes iscsid container keep restarting.

This patch makes sure that iscsi.service on host is disabled
when we deploy iscsid container, to avoid iscsid on host is started
unexpectedly.

Conflicts:
        docker/services/iscsid.yaml

Change-Id: I6c36cd15edfa53c3c76be9095ff40cecf451490d
Closes-Bug: #1833019
(cherry picked from commit 0d67ecaf75d9375e2a88479514ce6cb7e910ec5e)
(cherry picked from commit 5e70fa86918e7274e8ea02e79fa7a32e2ac22741)
(cherry picked from commit 0ff24b93973378605219650b255ba2fda4730fba)

commit_message:
Disable iscsi.service to avoid iscsid on host from getting started

When some stale shutdown happens on the node, iscsi.service detects
remaining information about iscsi connection, and recovers connections
based on the information, with starting iscsid service on host.
This causes a collision between iscsid on host and iscsid in container,
which makes iscsid container keep restarting.

This patch makes sure that iscsi.service on host is disabled
when we deploy iscsid container, to avoid iscsid on host is started
unexpectedly.

Conflicts:
        docker/services/iscsid.yaml

Change-Id: I6c36cd15edfa53c3c76be9095ff40cecf451490d
Closes-Bug: #1833019
(cherry picked from commit 0d67ecaf75d9375e2a88479514ce6cb7e910ec5e)
(cherry picked from commit 5e70fa86918e7274e8ea02e79fa7a32e2ac22741)

commit_message:
add StorageTransform class to prefilter

This change adds a StorageTransform Functor
that implements support for transforming the
hw_disk_bus and hw_cdrom_bus image metadata
properties into required traits.

Change-Id: Ifdabe1631202e2d26abc786a75cb93ec3d8f9ab0
Partial-Implements: bp/image-metadata-prefiltering

commit_message:
Retry heat stack polling on gateway problems

If the heat api is overloaded or temporarily unavailable, we might get a
503 or 504 from haproxy during the deployment. We should retry polling
for events in this case as to not prematurely exit the deployment.

Change-Id: I947cd0f9bf4a97e46c3d2bf3e9b986f7d38e9357
Closes-Bug: #1833452

monitoring.

commit_message:
Clean metrics related environments

This patch groups all metrics related environment files
to single directory and changes it's name to make more
sense.It also adds environment file for enabling RabbitMQ
monitoring.

Co-Authored-By: Nagasai Vinaykumar Kapalavai <vkapalav@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8419ef82e79d1e26c7b1fc267feadf909a7978d9
Depends-On: I248859bf0e4b70e3a057e96b5fb74be64f4008ed
(cherry picked from commit 492816a16637c41176778d0d1703bbafbba59885)

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Remove unncessary "=="

Change-Id: Iec1ee101e9d9cdedb19b272079a58653f715567a

commit_message:
Update strategy doc

Ceilometer removed cpu_util metric in [1].
Another metric compute.node.cpu.percent need to set
compute_monitors option to cpu.virt_driver in the
nova.conf, we should remind user about these.
[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/580709/

Change-Id: I89306ef7c26fa2927945bd4f3ee88b670511d147

commit_message:
Single tenant tests: BM to BM and BM to VM

No L2 isolation (same tenant) and L3 connectivity
Note: BM to VM will be skipped if Nova is not running

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-29 22:24:02.000000000', 'message': 'Track inventory for new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class

Track compute node inventory for the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT
resource class (added in os-resource-classes 0.4.0) which represents
the number of guests a compute node can host concurrently with memory
encrypted at the hardware level.

Initially this is required because on AMD SEV-capable hardware, the
memory controller has a fixed number of slots for holding encryption
keys, one per guest.  Typical hardware only has 15 slots, thereby
limiting the number of SEV guests which can be run concurrently to 15.
nova needs to track how many slots are available and used in order to
avoid attempting to exceeding that limit in the hardware.

Work is in progress to allow QEMU and libvirt to expose the number of
slots available on SEV hardware; however until this is finished and
released, it will not be possible for nova to programatically detect
the correct value with which to populate the MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT
inventory.  So add a new CONF.libvirt.num_memory_encrypted_guests
configuration option as a stop-gap, allowing the cloud operator to
provide this value manually, and then use it to populate the
inventory.

This depends on the change to os-resource-classes which adds the
MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Ib1304e65f1a203e6aed66e530d6e573c36165cd7

commit_message:
Add a new CONF.libvirt.num_memory_encrypted_guests option

This commit makes the preparations necessary to track inventory for
the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class, which was added in
os-resource-classes 0.4.0, and represents the number of guests a
compute node can host concurrently with memory encrypted at the
hardware level.

Initially this is required because on AMD SEV-capable hardware, the
memory controller has a fixed number of slots for holding encryption
keys, one per guest.  Typical hardware only has 15 slots, thereby
limiting the number of SEV guests which can be run concurrently to 15.
nova needs to track how many slots are available and used in order to
avoid attempting to exceeding that limit in the hardware.

Work is in progress to allow QEMU and libvirt to expose the number of
slots available on SEV hardware; however until this is finished and
released, it will not be possible for nova to programatically detect
the correct value with which to populate the MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT
inventory.

So add a new CONF.libvirt.num_memory_encrypted_guests configuration
option as a stop-gap, allowing the cloud operator to provide this
value manually.

A follow-up commit will use the value of this configuration option to
populate the inventory.  That commit will be the final "switch"
enabling all AMD SEV functionality in one go.  However
os-resource-classes is bumped to 0.4.0 here to facilitate advance
preparation and testing.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Ib1304e65f1a203e6aed66e530d6e573c36165cd7

[{'created': '2019-06-20 14:26:24.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo-hieradata/per-host: use inventory_hostname

Use {{ inventory_hostname }} to read out the actual hostname when
creating the per-host hieradata files.

hosts directly.

Change-Id: If6ce103ad022a5dfaa1fefaf83839886d4ce460d
'}]
commit_message:
tripleo-hieradata/per-host: use inventory_hostname

Use {{ inventory_hostname }} to read out the actual hostname when
creating the per-host hieradata files.

Also removing the useless loop in main, since the task is run on the
hosts directly.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/664578/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 40m 06s'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2019-06-18 07:04:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Formatting looks good indeed:
http://logs.openstack.org/78/664578/2/check/build-openstack-releasenotes/4fa794c/html/unreleased.html

Though, the old release note does appear in Train. From what I remember, reno uses file date by default? Can we arrange that so it only appears in its original section? (I vaguely recall some similar tweak we did with armax for networking-sfc, but I need to dig further)'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-06-18 14:21:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Bernard - I think reno is basing placement based on git tags, and this would be in "current".  There is a page somewhere, but Doug Hellman would be the best to ask if we can't figure it out.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-06-18 14:29:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Bernard, looking at https://docs.openstack.org/reno/latest/user/usage.html it seems we can modify releasenotes/source/unreleased.rst and add a section to ignore the note, but then I'm assuming when we cherry-pick it to stable/stein it will be placed in the stein one?"}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-06-18 14:35:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-06-18 14:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Sounds like a plan! Yeah I figure it will have to be moved to respective ranch for each backport, and then we should see the new release note accordingly.
But proactive test sounds good :)'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-06-18 16:28:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/664578/3 : SUCCESS in 1h 52m 35s'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2019-06-19 06:49:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

One more thing (sorry I think about it only now), we should also "force" the older relnote appearance when it appeared originally - currently it is nowhere in generated http://logs.openstack.org/78/664578/3/check/build-openstack-releasenotes/95cb024/html
Aside from that the ignore option seems to work fine'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-06-19 20:00:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Bernard - yes, I think if we cherry-pick this and remove the unreleased.rst change it will show up in the Stein release notes.  That's my next step."}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-06-19 20:00:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit 18737c0a8eeae47ebd4ad46aa94cbfa0b18b2373'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-06-20 14:28:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

So I think instead of using the unreleased directive, this change should only have the new note, and the stable/stein one have the one we removed.  That way the Stein release notes will be restored in the right section.

I'll fix them up."}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-06-20 14:41:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-06-20 16:29:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/664578/4 : FAILURE in 1h 46m 17s'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-06-20 20:03:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

This and the two cherry-picks seem to do the right thing - the new note is added in master, while each cherry-pick adds the note we removed in that branch's section."}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2019-06-20 21:40:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Release notes for dns_domain behavioural changes

As part of the fix for bug 1826419, a prior release note was
deleted and no new release note was added to document the
change in behaviour as a result of upgrading.

Add new release note to detail the behaviour of
{network,conf}.dns_domain with respect to the DHCP agent
post upgrade.

The deleted release note will be restored in the stable
branches where it was removed.

Change-Id: Ic668d64c28cdc1068cb2413b09839a127bad46d3
Related-Bug: 1826419

[{'created': '2019-06-20 10:56:37.000000000', 'message': 'Join on explcit relationship paths

The join() in get_router_for_floatingip() is joining from entity
to entity without an explicit ON clause which creates an ambiguous
situation. SQLAlchemy 1.3 guards against this now, so use the
real relationship-bound path so that the ORM does not need to guess.

This mock replicates the original query without the
"gw_port.device_owner == DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_GW" filter.

Error [1] found in [2].

Based on [3].

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/748825
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/649508
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/642117

Change-Id: I7e12e2a2b6f9e8eb2233819f41d1065c95f0d552
Closes-Bug: #1823059
(cherry picked from commit a39bc9758cc713d46092101475ac4edd404f93f5)
'}]
commit_message:
Join on explcit relationship paths

The join() in get_router_for_floatingip() is joining from entity
to entity without an explicit ON clause which creates an ambiguous
situation. SQLAlchemy 1.3 guards against this now, so use the
real relationship-bound path so that the ORM does not need to guess.

This mock replicates the original query without the
"gw_port.device_owner == DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_GW" filter.

Error [1] found in [2].

Based on [3].

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/748825
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/649508
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/642117

Change-Id: I7e12e2a2b6f9e8eb2233819f41d1065c95f0d552
Closes-Bug: #1823059
(cherry picked from commit a39bc9758cc713d46092101475ac4edd404f93f5)

commit_message:
Add fwaas_v2 log optional configuration in l3_agent.ini

When configuring fwaas_v2 log, we can specify rate_limit, burst_limit
and local_output_log_base options in nework_log section.

Change-Id: Iba061c399599cf601c22054b3924b9a74f0f4fa0

commit_message:
Upgrade playbook fixes for OS upgrade

These are remaining fixes for pacemaker and mysql tasks to make
upgrade_steps_playbook.yaml pass on machines after operating system
upgrade to EL 8.

Change-Id: If8c97752463e560c60d35e10081b5105816e66f6

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-32912 : SUCCESS in 1h 41m 29s'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-06-19 20:04:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-06-19 21:09:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

This seems like it could/should be consolidated with at least one or two of its predecessors.

Also, at some point here I imagine there should be a doc update and a reno. Generally those things would happen in the patch that flips the master switch where this functionality becomes available.

That said, there doesn't seem to be a master switch in this series. Which may be kind of a problem, since at various points in this series you could enable bits and pieces of the feature, which could lead to unpredictable behavior.

I'm thinking what might be best is to move the MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT patch [1] last in the series, since, without that, you can't make any of the rest of this happen. Then in that patch you can do your docs & reno.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662105/"}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-06-19 22:46:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-32921 : FAILURE in 2h 13m 59s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-06-19 22:50:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/662558/9 : FAILURE in 2h 20m 32s'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-06-20 13:56:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-06-20 14:18:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11: Patch Set 10 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-06-20 15:43:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12: Patch Set 11 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-06-20 18:46:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/662558/12 : SUCCESS in 2h 19m 47s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-06-20 18:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

I'm all for small patches, but I still think this series is too long. IMO:

- We should combine all the patches that touch config.py
- We should combine all the patches that touch libvirt.py for lifecycle events (spawn etc. as opposed to update_provider_tree), possibly even combining these with ^
- The "master switch" patch should a) make update_provider_tree report *both* the inventory and the trait; b) introduce the CONF option; and c) contain the docs and reno.

But at least that first thing, please.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-06-20 20:31:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

OK.  I would expect this to make the patches a bit harder to review for me personally, but it's not me who has to review them, and you're the boss ;-)

It does also slightly weaken the value of things like git bisect and cherry-pick, but probably not a big deal."}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-06-20 20:45:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

Merged into Ie54fca066f3333d1d5d18a2c0e8f6c7d5042490b at Eric's request, but I don't have permissions to abandon this."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-06-20 22:11:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

commit_message:
Enable memory locking if SEV is requested

All the memory pages allocated by QEMU must be pinned for SEV. Use
<memoryBacking> and <locked /> elements in order to achieve it.

Change-Id: Ic03bbec8879cca799d1fcc2d70f7e8339bc5635c
blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

commit_message:
Allow guest devices to include <driver iommu='on' />

AMD SEV requires to enable DMA APIs for virtio devices. The DMA APIs are enabled
through <driver iommu='on' />.

http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#proposed-change

So add necessary bits for that to domain configuration.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

Change-Id: Ia1798deeb9e3c774ed7aa0dcb8ed55f9dcedf674

5 minutes to create the rps, inventory, traits, aggregates, but this is not really indicative of write capacity as the client side is limiting concurrency

46 seconds to get them in one GET /a_c

For 1000 it is 1.5 seconds.

This is non-linear so might be interesting to do some profiling with this size to see where the hit is:

* database interactions
* filtering database results into python structures
* turning those python structures into JSON'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-05-07 17:23:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-05-09 21:53:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-05-09 21:54:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11: Patch Set 10 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-22 19:19:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12: Patch Set 11 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-05-28 10:05:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-05-28 11:22:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

we've improved things lately (probably with removing the null provider protections), compare:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-06 18:10:07.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: See what happens with 10000 resource providers

At the PTG, CERN pointed out that placement is slower when
the number of resource providers gets very large, so I thought
it would be useful to adjust perfload to 10,000 providers.

This is simply a "let's see what that looks like". As such
other jobs in .zuul.yaml are turned off.

Change-Id: I0ccd87d737c3c08a0ac448ec3323297623489cff

'}, {'created': '2019-05-06 21:11:46.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: See what happens with 5000 resource providers

At the PTG, CERN pointed out that placement is slower when
the number of resource providers gets very large, so I thought
it would be useful to adjust perfload to 10,000 providers.

This is simply a "let's see what that looks like". As such
other jobs in .zuul.yaml are turned off in check, with a
few left as a guard in gate.

At at COUNT of 10,000 uwsgi wants more file descriptors,
so going to try 5000 and see what happens. The other option
is to raise the number of available file descriptors but...

Change-Id: I0ccd87d737c3c08a0ac448ec3323297623489cff

the number of resource providers gets very large, so I thought
it would be useful to adjust perfload to 10,000 providers.

This is simply a "let's see what that looks like". As such
other jobs in .zuul.yaml are turned off in check, with a
few left as a guard in gate.

A new version of placeload is required to properly manage
concurrency while creating resource providers.

Change-Id: I0ccd87d737c3c08a0ac448ec3323297623489cff

commit_message:
DNM: See what happens with 10000 resource providers

At the PTG, CERN pointed out that placement is slower when
the number of resource providers gets very large, so I thought
it would be useful to adjust perfload to 10,000 providers.

This is simply a "let's see what that looks like". As such
other jobs in .zuul.yaml are turned off in check, with a
few left as a guard in gate.

A new version of placeload is required to properly manage
concurrency while creating resource providers.

Change-Id: I0ccd87d737c3c08a0ac448ec3323297623489cff

commit_message:
Install python-systemd package for journal logging

With journal logging now enabled by default, the python-systemd package
package needs to be included in neutron_service_distro_packages for
distro package based installs.

Change-Id: I247cf33c8393f68688e0c65355d8e9bc6519539d

commit_message:
Additional VIPs is also relevant in provider_base

Though this is just an abstract class so it doesn't break functionality,
it should be kept up to date for the sake of implementers.

Story: 2005608
Task: 33612

subject: Allow amp_id filtering on amphora rest operations
messages:
[{'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-01-13 01:42:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-01-13 02:13:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-01-13 05:28:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-01-13 08:11:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-01-15 18:58:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

An argument could be made that we should make the amp driver work on one amp at a time only an push the iteration over amps up into the flows.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-01-15 23:37:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I am still trying to wrap my head around what we are actually trying to achieve but I agree with Michael that we should push that to the flow layer.

Historically we assumed amps are dumb and all have the same state by always pushing the current state to them. I need to see the application and the use case to understand if what this does would violate that and if so if it would be ok.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-01-15 23:49:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Yeah, the more I think about this, the more clear it is that we should make the amp driver only work on a single amp passed in and iterate over amps, if needed, in the flows. This would all those iterations to be parallel executed and allow per-amp retries.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-01-16 18:28:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I think there is an issue to in that for an amphora failover we need to push new configs to *both* amps so that the peer sync IPs get updated.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-01-16 22:42:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

Yes, you're correct, we really DO need to at least try to push configs out to all amps for haproxy peering configs and keepalived vrrp peer configs... I forgot about those. :(

But, the bug this was trying to solve *is* real, and I've now filed it here: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2001481"}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2019-06-20 21:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I believe this was all addressed in the patch that fixed amp failover if both amps were failed. See the story: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2001481'}]

Before, any operation would happen to all amphorae -- but, we should be

Change-Id: Iae861d925e060cee4dfb05286b78052324ed25b9
'}, {'created': '2018-01-13 08:11:29.000000000', 'message': "Allow amp_id filtering on amphora rest operations

Before, any operation would happen to all amphorae -- but, we should be
able to limit operations to only a specific amphora, for use in failover
tasks.

Also fix network deltas for amphora failover (we really should only make
any changes to the new amphora we're spinning up -- no touching the
other one in an ACTIVE/STANDBY pair.

Change-Id: Iae861d925e060cee4dfb05286b78052324ed25b9
"}]
commit_message:
Allow amp_id filtering on amphora rest operations

Before, any operation would happen to all amphorae -- but, we should be
able to limit operations to only a specific amphora, for use in failover
tasks.

Also fix network deltas for amphora failover (we really should only make
any changes to the new amphora we're spinning up -- no touching the
other one in an ACTIVE/STANDBY pair.

Change-Id: Iae861d925e060cee4dfb05286b78052324ed25b9

commit_message:
remove ec2 object definitions

ec2 was deprecated in commit
f098398a836e3671c49bb884b4a1a1988053f4b2
back to mitaka release, this patch
starts to remove ec2 object related functions
and api utils.

Change-Id: Icf62fbd1e7948a5035be28eca17116a87ce8c388

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: I3c542a6166174823e9c8e76ceafa2c9ea733592b
Story: #2004073
Task: #27440

add python 3.7 unit test job

If I understand you correctly, it sounds like you agree that this test should be skipped?"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-06-12 22:10:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Hi Goutham, this is just with the generic backend: share_driver=manila.share.drivers.generic.GenericShareDriver
> If I understand you correctly, it sounds like you agree that this test should be skipped?


Thanks, I'm okay with skipping given the current capability of these scenario tests. These tests only test IP based access control (See [a]). "user" based access control scenario testing has been on a wishlist for CIFS protocol shares. 

Please see some comments inline regarding the link/explanation in the commit message.

[{'created': '2019-06-10 20:06:02.000000000', 'message': 'Skip read-only test for CIFS

When using the CIFS protocol and trying to share a share by IP, the
share fails to instantiate and the manila service produces this error:

  InvalidShareAccessLevel: Invalid or unsupported share access level: ro.

This is because the RO access level is explicitly denied for a CIFS
share shared by IP[1]. This patch causes the test to be skipped in such
a case.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/src/commit/35d327e4638aa4bfb2ba68fbc602a827816e782b/manila/share/drivers/helpers.py

share fails to instantiate and the manila service produces this error:

  InvalidShareAccessLevel: Invalid or unsupported share access level: ro.

There are no Manila Share backends that support CIFS shares with read
only access when authenticating with IP addresses[1]. This patch causes
the test to be skipped in such a case.

commit_message:
Skip read-only test for CIFS

When using the CIFS protocol and trying to share a share by IP, the
share fails to instantiate and the manila service produces this error:

  InvalidShareAccessLevel: Invalid or unsupported share access level: ro.

There are no Manila Share backends that support CIFS shares with read
only access when authenticating with IP addresses[1]. This patch causes
the test to be skipped in such a case.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/admin/share_back_ends_feature_support_mapping.html#mapping-of-share-drivers-and-share-access-rules-support

Change-Id: Ic30eaf3c2b7f75eb4bc62159faceb6bd30d7e03b

commit_message:
Messaging: use htk function to directly hit RabbitMQ servers

This PS updates the charts to use the htk function recently introduced
to allow oslo.messaging clients ans servers to directly hit their
backends rather than using either DNS or K8S svc based routing.

Depends-On: I5150a64bd29fa062e30496c1f2127de138322863

Change-Id: I458b4313c57fc50c8181cedeca9919670487926a
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
WIP: Document AMD SEV support for encrypted VMs in libvirt

Document AMD SEV support as planned in the AMD SEV spec[0]:

- Add operation.boot-encrypted-vm to the KVM hypervisor feature matrix.

- Update the KVM section of the Configuration Guide.

- Add a release note.

[0] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#documentation-impact

Change-Id: I656eba5c92c4842e88f66b4f12a136856c009b90

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-30 16:06:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix IP address access for CIFS

Without this patch, if the CIFS protocol is used, the auxiliary access
function returns None, which means the access object cannot be used by
the caller. This patch ensures the access object is actually returned.

Change-Id: Id6a44ea8c6b88d121983566dbb176f48e470094f
'}, {'created': '2019-06-10 19:14:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix CIFS access for non-multitenant setup

In the case that multitenancy_enabled is false, the CIFS tests fail,
first because the auxiliary access function returns None, which means
the access object cannot be used by the caller, and second because if a
floating IP address isn't chosen explicitly as the share point, the
server's fixed IP may be chosen which is not in the same segment as the
share server, which means the share will not be accessible. This patch
fixes both issues by making the auxiliary access granting function
consistent for both NFS and CIFS and differentiating instead on
multitenancy_enabled.

Change-Id: Id6a44ea8c6b88d121983566dbb176f48e470094f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix CIFS access for non-multitenant setup

In the case that multitenancy_enabled is false, the CIFS tests fail,
first because the auxiliary access function returns None, which means
the access object cannot be used by the caller, and second because if a
floating IP address isn't chosen explicitly as the share point, the
server's fixed IP may be chosen which is not in the same segment as the
share server, which means the share will not be accessible. This patch
fixes both issues by making the auxiliary access granting function
consistent for both NFS and CIFS and differentiating instead on
multitenancy_enabled.

Change-Id: Id6a44ea8c6b88d121983566dbb176f48e470094f

commit_message:
Add new parameter NovaLiveMigrationWaitForVIFPlug

Add parameter NovaLiveMigrationWaitForVIFPlug which allows to set
`compute/live_migration_wait_for_vif_plug` which in turn allows
whether to wait for ``network-vif-plugged`` events before
starting guest transfer.

The default value for the parameter is set to true and it is
set to false when `ovn` is in `NeutronMechanismDrivers` list.

Depends-On: I0048d1f57eeb3418b52f225f87810ea1a7250a0f
Change-Id: I1ce38ea3ef6ba40625adc8da90903aac397cf60e

(cherry picked from commit 81fad32be6da6d1be753f4972ca596fba2f1ce8a)

commit_message:
Only update parameters once in backup workflow

In the swift backup workflow we create 2 parameters for temp URLs, but
we don't need to call parameters.update twice, just once with the two
new parameters.

Change-Id: I75b64dca102a62c06c56327cf425451ae804e3b9
Related-Bug: #1817539
(cherry picked from commit e07dc79693ef1300a8b4cb900effe95314f18fac)
(cherry picked from commit b41d18c5f83a33ef37c3579b5c84b02db3ddf82a)

commit_message:
Add tripleo-ansible directory namespace

The tripleo-ansible project will now install it's contents into a
namespaced directory. This was done to ensure we can smoothly
transition to using tripleo-ansible without having to worry about
conflicting files. To ensure our services are able to access this
namespace the configuration PATH has been updated to include the
new namespace.

Depends-On: Iedbf9d1034ee3396d6cb064c64169c21ebcf3e18
Change-Id: I128646937b02902f92c22259e97c9e6024769234
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Convert aide puppet to ansible

The aide heat template was using puppet to configure the service.
This change removes `aide-baremetal-puppet.yaml` and replaces it
with `aide-baremetal-ansible.yaml` in an effort to decrease our
reliance on puppet.

> Once this change has been merged a follow-up patch will be made
  to puppet-tripleo to eliminate the aide manifest files.

Change-Id: I4479de4c157625be50fdbec33cbf43b30dd7558f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Stop deleting-and-creating RabbitMQ account

The `force` option creates and recreates the user which means on
any deploy it kills *all* AMQP traffic on all agents.

This updates it when changed every single run, which shouldn't
kill the connectivity when we run playbooks.

Change-Id: I5c2478b41d49dd3e4392c1800ad6a7e7c1494152
Closes-Bug: 1825329
(cherry picked from commit 5879ae1891049f6464b8c2a5f5990b36eed62954)

commit_message:
Stop deleting-and-creating RabbitMQ account

The `force` option creates and recreates the user which means on
any deploy it kills *all* AMQP traffic on all agents.

This updates it when changed every single run, which shouldn't
kill the connectivity when we run playbooks.

Change-Id: I5c2478b41d49dd3e4392c1800ad6a7e7c1494152
Closes-Bug: 1825329
